addictinginfo.org.name: Addicting Info
addictinginfo.org.notes: Addicting Info provides a blend of news geared toward liberals along with research intensive articles meant to debunk conservative myths.  With that said they do have a strong left wing bias in reporting and they do not hide it.  They occasionally publish satire that may be misleading to some.

advocate.com.name: Advocate
advocate.com.notes: The Advocate is an American LGBT-interest magazine, printed bi-monthly and available by subscription. The Advocate brand also includes a website. Both magazine and website have an editorial focus on news, politics, opinion, and arts and entertainment of interest to lesbians, gay men, bisexuals and transgender (LGBT) people. (Wikipedia)

allthatsfab.com.name: All That’s Fab
allthatsfab.com.notes: All That’s Fab is a news and opinion website with an extreme left bias in reporting.  The source uses sensational headlines that do not match the content of the articles. Occasionally does not source to credible information.

alternativemediasyndicate.com.name: Alternative Media Syndicate
alternativemediasyndicate.com.notes: The Alternative Media Syndicate is a news and opinion website/blog that has a strong left wing bias. Presents information with moderate loaded words and sometimes links to questionable sources. Has a very strong liberal bias in story selection and does not have an “about” page. According to Snopes has published a false news story.

alternet.org.name: AlterNet
alternet.org.notes: AlterNet is a liberal activist news service and a project of the non-profit Independent Media Institute that Launched in 1998.  Very strong left wing bias through report choices and strongly worded headlines.  Some articles are sourced to other biased sources and may need a fact check.

aidc.org.za.name: Amandla
aidc.org.za.notes: Amandla! is a South African bi-monthly magazine that was launched in 2006. The founders are Mazibuko K. Jara, and Brian Ashley. The magazine is published by the Alternative Information and Development Centre (AIDC) and provides coverage and analysis of current political, economic and social processes from a radical left perspective.

americablog.com.name: AmericaBlog
americablog.com.notes: AMERICAblog is a liberal American blog founded by John Aravosis in April 2004, with several co-bloggers. Has a pretty strong left wing bias.

americanbridgepac.org.name: American Bridge 21st Century
americanbridgepac.org.notes: American Bridge 21st Century is a liberal American Super PAC that supports Democratic candidates and opposes Republican candidates. It was founded by David Brock in 2010 and is associated with Media Matters for America. It is an opposition research hub for the Democratic Party. The group physically tracks and monitors Republican candidates and officials and uses social media to deploy its findings (Wikipedia). This source uses loaded words to describe Republicans and does not always source claims.

americannewsx.com.name: American News X
americannewsx.com.notes: American News X is a website that features news, op-eds and satire.  All of which are categorized and labeled as such. News and Op-eds are presented with a left wing bias in wording and story selection. Most news is well sourced, but occasionally is linked to other left biased sources.

backedbyfact.com.name: Backed by Fact
backedbyfact.com.notes: Backed by Fact is a news and opinion blog that sources well. However, they do tend to source to left leaning information and they do use loaded words when describing conservatives.

ebar.com.name: Bay Area Reporter
ebar.com.notes: The Bay Area Reporter is a free weekly newspaper serving the LGBT communities in the San Francisco Bay Area; it is one of the largest circulation LGBT newspapers by circulation in the United States and the country’s oldest continuously published newspaper of its kind (Wikipedia). Well written and well sourced. Has a liberal political bias in story selection.

bipartisanreport.com.name: Bipartisan Report
bipartisanreport.com.notes: Has a very clear and strong liberal bias.  Occasionally publishes pseudoscience and conspiracies.  Needs strong fact checking from credible sources.

blackagendareport.com.name: Black Agenda Report
blackagendareport.com.notes: Black Agenda Report is a news and opinion website and radio program.  The articles are well written and in general factually accurate. The site does have a clear left wing political bias through story selection and some wording.

blacklivesmatter.com.name: Black Lives Matter
blacklivesmatter.com.notes: Black Lives Matter (BLM) is an international activist movement, originating in the African-American community, that campaigns against violence and systemic racism toward black people. BLM regularly protests police killings of black people and broader issues of racial profiling, police brutality, and racial inequality in the United States criminal justice system (Wikipedia).

bluedotdaily.com.name: Blue Dot Daily
bluedotdaily.com.notes: The Blue Dot Daily is a news and opinion blog that sometimes uses sensational headlines to report current news with a clear left bias, but they do openly state that they are not a news media source, but rather a blog. Bottom line: Extreme left bias in wording and relatively factual reporting (F. Locke-Siewert).

bluenationreview.com.name: Blue Nation Review
bluenationreview.com.notes: Blue Nation Review is now called Share Blue.  This source is owned by David Brock, a political operative of the Hillary Clinton Campaign.  During the election this source only published Pro-Clinton content or negative reports on her opponents.  After the election the source is publishing a highly one sided viewpoint that favors liberals.

boingboing.net.name: Boing Boing
boingboing.net.notes: Boing Boing is a website, first established as a zine in 1988, later becoming a group blog. Common themes include technology, futurism, science fiction, gadgets, intellectual property, Disney and left-wing politics(Wikipedia).

bust.com.name: Bust Magazine
bust.com.notes: BUST Magazine is a women’s lifestyle magazine that is published six times a year. BUST covers music, news, crafts, art, sex, and fashion from an independent (“indie”), third wave feminist perspective (Wikipedia).

canadiandimension.com.name: Canadian Dimension
canadiandimension.com.notes: Described as a magazine “for people who want to change the world”, Canadian Dimension is a forum for left-wing political thought that ranges from New Democratic Party-style social democracy to libertarian socialism.  Very strong evidence based journalism, but clearly biased in presentation.

carbonated.tv.name: Carbonated TV
carbonated.tv.notes: Carbonated TV is a news and opinion website that relies on video for news reporting. Carbonated TV has a strong left wing bias in reporting through the use of emotive words and story selection. They do however source their information back to reasonable sources.

americanprogress.org.name: Center for American Progress
americanprogress.org.notes: Founded by John Podesta who is Chairman of the Hillary Clinton 2016 campaign.  Reporting favors Clinton and has liberal bias with report selection.

prwatch.org.name: Center for Media and Democracy
prwatch.org.notes: The Center for Media and Democracy (CMD) is a non-partisan progressive watchdog group led by Lisa Graves. CMD manages this website, SourceWatch.org. As noted on SourceWatch’s sister site, PRWatch.org, CMD “strengthens participatory democracy by investigating and exposing public relations spin and propaganda such as corporate greenwashing, and by promoting media literacy and citizen journalism.” CMD also manages the BanksterUSA website. CMD was founded in 1993 by John Stauber.  Some contend that CMD is not neutral. CMD has been criticized for having an anti-corporate viewpoint (Wikipedia).

change.org.name: Change.org
change.org.notes: Change.org is a petition website operated by Change.org, Inc., an American certified B corporation which claims to have over 100 million users and hosts sponsored campaigns for organizations.  Popular topics of Change.org petitions are economic and criminal justice, human rights, education, environmental protection, animals rights, health, and sustainable food.  (Wikipedia)

chicagoreader.com.name: Chicago Reader
chicagoreader.com.notes: The Chicago Reader is an American alternative weekly newspaper in Chicago, Illinois, noted for its literary style of journalism and coverage of the arts, particularly film and theater.

commondreams.org.name: Common Dreams
commondreams.org.notes: Common Dreams, is a 501(c)3 nonprofit U.S.-based progressive news website. Common Dreams publishes news stories, editorials and a newswire of current breaking news. Common Dreams also re-publishes relevant content from numerous other sources such as the Associated Press. The website also provides links to other relevant columnists, periodicals, radio outlets, news services, and websites (Wikipedia). Overall, Common Dreams produces solid journalism and sources their information well.  The only fault is they sometimes source other far left sources rather more neutral ones.

cosmopolitan.com.name: Cosmopolitan
cosmopolitan.com.notes: Cosmopolitan is an international fashion magazine for women and has a circulation of over 3 million. (Wikipedia) Cosmo’s primary focus is on fashion, sex and relationship tips, but they also cover politics.  Cosmo has a strong left wing bias in reporting and story selection. Though biased, Cosmo usual published sourced information.

counterpunch.org.name: CounterPunch
counterpunch.org.notes: CounterPunch is a bi-monthly magazine published in the United States that covers politics in a manner its editors describe as “muckraking with a radical attitude”. It has been described as left-wing by both supporters and detractors (Wikipedia).  CounterPunch provides excellent journalism and sources their information.  As indicated they have a left wing bias politically and they run a lot opinion type pieces which they indicate.

crooksandliars.com.name: Crooks and Liars
crooksandliars.com.notes: Crooks and Liars is a progressive news blog focusing on political events and the news coverage of them (Wikipedia). For the most part Crooks and Liars sources, but at times they are conspiratorial.  Some stories might require a fact check.

currentaffairs.org.name: Current Affairs Magazine
currentaffairs.org.notes: Current Affairs is a magazine that publishes bi-monthly in print and online. It was started by Nathan J. Robinson, a PhD student at Harvard University in 2015 via a kickstarter campaign. Its stated aims are to be an informative and entertaining independent publication. (Wikipedia) Current affairs covers politics and culture with a left wing bias.  They do however source their information well and tend to be factual.

thedailybeast.com.name: Daily Beast
thedailybeast.com.notes: The Daily Beast is an American news reporting and opinion website focusing on politics and pop culture.  The Daily Beast has been accused of biased reporting favoring Hillary Clinton during the 2016 election.  The Daily Beast tends to sensationalize headlines, but they do typically source the info in their reports.

dailydot.com.name: Daily Dot
dailydot.com.notes: The Daily Dot is a digital media company covering Internet culture and life on the web.  Moderate left wing political bias in reporting.

mirror.co.uk.name: Daily Mirror
mirror.co.uk.notes: The Daily Mirror is a British national daily tabloid newspaper founded in 1903. The Daily Mirror is not known for high journalism.  It is a sensationalized tabloid with very bold headlines and little substance.  It sometimes is not factual.

dailynewsbin.com.name: Daily News Bin
dailynewsbin.com.notes: The Daily News Bin is a web based news and politics website. It has a strong left wing bias through report choices that favors the left and uses strong loaded words in headlines and reports. For example, on December 14, 2016 there is an Op-Ed with the headline: “Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump are simply anti-American terrorists.” The use of the words “anti-American terrorists” is a classic use of loaded words to entice clicks.  According to Web of Trust the Daily News Bin has been flagged for trustworthiness based on misleading claims and being unethical. Snopes has rated three stories as false in 2016. According to our user ratings, Daily News Bin has been rated as Extreme Left biased 76% of the time.  When reporting news the Daily News Bin uses mostly neutral headlines and sources information to credible media. The problem with Daily News Bin is their over-the-top political bias on opinion pieces, overshadows their often excellent journalism in news reporting.

dallasvoice.com.name: Dallas Voice
dallasvoice.com.notes: Dallas Voice, founded in 1984, is a newspaper for the gay community in Dallas, Texas (USA).  Typical left wing political bias with report choices and sourced information.

deadstate.org.name: Dead State
deadstate.org.notes: Dead State is an online news and opinion website with a strong left wing bias through the use of loaded words, attention grabbing headlines and story selection. Within the actual articles you find well sourced information that tends to come from reputable left-center and left sources.  Dead State is clearly a left leaning news source, but backs up reports with credible sourcing.

democracynow.org.name: Democracy Now
democracynow.org.notes: Democracy Now! is an hour-long American TV, radio and internet news program hosted by Progressive journalists Amy Goodman and Juan Gonzalez. The show, which airs live each weekday at 08:00 ET, is broadcast on the internet and by nearly 1,400 radio and television stations worldwide.  Has a typical left wing bias with opinions, but reports news factually.

democraticunderground.com.name: Democratic Underground
democraticunderground.com.notes: Democratic Underground, also known as DU, is an online community for U.S. Democrats. Its membership is restricted by policy to those who are supportive of the Democratic Party and Democratic candidates for political office (Wikipedia). Has a strong left wing bias simply because all members are sworn democrats.

dissentmagazine.org.name: Dissent Magazine
dissentmagazine.org.notes: Dissent is a quarterly, left-wing journal focusing on politics and culture edited by Michael Kazin and David Marcus. The journal is published by the University of Pennsylvania Press on behalf of the Foundation for the Study of Independent Social Ideas, Inc.

drudge.com.name: Drudge Retort
drudge.com.notes: The Drudge Retort was created as a left leaning parody of the Drudge Report.  The site was designed in a similar style and releases news in a similar way.  The difference is the Drudge Retort is left biased.

economyincrisis.org.name: Economy In Crisis
economyincrisis.org.notes: Economy In Crisis, INC (EconomyInCrisis.org) is a non-profit corporation dedicated to educating legislators and the American public on the destruction of our country’s industrial base.  Pretty typical left bias, but is weak on science and dabbles in left wing conspiracies.

electronicintifada.net.name: Electronic Intifada
electronicintifada.net.notes: Electronic Intifada is a news publication and educational resource focusing on Palestine, its people, politics, culture and place in the world.

elitedaily.com.name: Elite Daily
elitedaily.com.notes: Elite Daily is an American online news platform. Self-described as “Millennials’ preferred platform for today’s hot issues and trending topics”, its slogan is “The Voice of Generation Y”. In addition to general news, the site offers feature stories and listicles in the areas of politics, social justice, sex and dating, college life, women’s issues, money, sports, and humor. (Wikipedia) Elite Daily publishes mostly entertainment and lifestyle news, but they do cover politics also.  They have a left bias in reporting and wording.  Elite Daily occasionally publishes a misleading or poorly sourced article.

esquire.com.name: Esquire Magazine
esquire.com.notes: Esquire is an American men’s magazine, published by the Hearst Corporation in the United States that was founded in 1933. Covers a wide variety of topics including entertainment, fashion and politics.  Politically, Esquire has a typical left wing bias.  Has a fleet of editors to ensure they are factual and correct mistakes.

everydayfeminism.com.name: Everyday Feminism
everydayfeminism.com.notes: Everyday Feminism is a feminist online educational platform that features articles on gender, race, religion, sex, health, and class. It has a stated mission to help dismantle violence, discrimination, and marginalization.

evonomics.com.name: Evonomics
evonomics.com.notes: Evonomics is a progressive website that focuses on mostly progressive economics. While the bias is pretty strong against capitalism they do source well to mostly credible sources.

filmingcops.com.name: Filming Cops
filmingcops.com.notes: According to the Filming Cops “About Page” they were started in 2010 as a conglomerative reporting service documenting police abuse. They state that “the aim isn’t to demonize the natural concept of security provision as such, but to highlight specific cases of State-monopolized police brutality that are otherwise ignored by traditional media outlets.”  Although Filming Cops does what it claims, it is 100% one sided and therefore extremely biased against police. It does however, publish real footage, it is questionable if there is editing, but the footage is real.

forwardprogressives.com.name: Forward Progressives
forwardprogressives.com.notes: Forward Progressives as a news and opinion website with a left bias in reporting and wording.  They also published some false stories according to Snopes.

thefreethoughtproject.com.name: Free Thought Project
thefreethoughtproject.com.notes: Free Thought Project reports some real news as well as conspiracy and left-wing sensationalism.

gizmodo.com.name: Gizmodo
gizmodo.com.notes: Gizmodo is primarily a design, technology and science fiction website.  However, they do occasionally report on politics, especially if it concerns technology.  Politically, Gizmodo leans left in reporting.

good.is.name: Good Magazine
good.is.notes: Good Magazine was started in 2006. The website receives about 10.1 M unique visitors to its website each month. (Wikipedia)  The magazine covers a variety topics that are geared toward positive social and environmental change.  The source is mostly factual, but it has a left bias in reporting and story selection.

gq.com.name: GQ Magazine
gq.com.notes: GQ (formerly Gentlemen’s Quarterly) is an international monthly men’s magazine based in New York City. The publication focuses on fashion, style, and culture for men, though articles on food, movies, fitness, sex, music, travel, sports, technology, books and politics are also featured. (Wikipedia)  GQ has a left wing political bias in reporting, but they generally are factual and source their information.  Has been accused of sexism.

greenvillegazette.com.name: Greenville Gazette
greenvillegazette.com.notes: This website collects and repackages news stories with a liberal bias.

news.groopspeak.com.name: Groopspeak
news.groopspeak.com.notes: Groopspeak is a news and opinion website with an extreme left wing bias.  Many stories are overly sensationalized with misleading headlines.

guardianlv.com.name: Guardian Liberty Voice
guardianlv.com.notes: Guardian Liberty Voice is a news and opinion website that tries to cover all sides, but they do lean more to left in reporting.

huffingtonpost.com.name: Huffington Post
huffingtonpost.com.notes: The Huffington Post is an American online news aggregator and blog that has both localized and international editions founded by Arianna Huffington, Kenneth Lerer, Andrew Breitbart, and Jonah Peretti (Wikipedia). Has typical left wing bias through story selection and word choices.  Not evidence based on some scientific issues, but generally well sourced overall.

ifyouonlynews.com.name: If You Only News
ifyouonlynews.com.notes: If You Only News is a news and opinion site that has a far left bias.  Many stories seem to blur the line between satire and actual news.  While some of their stories are factual many are propaganda and flat out fake news stories.

inequalitymedia.org.name: Inequality Media
inequalitymedia.org.notes: Inequality Media produces original film and video, share their content through social media and media outlets to raise awareness about the issues, and partner with leading organizations to provide an avenue through which viewers can engage, mobilize, and take action again inequality. Inequality Media has a left wing political bias, but produces videos that are well sourced and factual.

inthesetimes.com.name: In These Times
inthesetimes.com.notes: In These Times is an American politically progressive/democratic socialist monthly magazine of news and opinion published by the Institute for Public Affairs in Chicago, Illinois (Wikipedia). This is a very solid source for well written factual stories.

jacobinmag.com.name: Jacobin
jacobinmag.com.notes: Jacobin is a left-wing quarterly magazine based in New York. It claims to be a “leading voice of the American left, offering socialist perspectives on politics, economics, and culture”.  It is biased in reporting, but very well written and sourced.

jezebel.com.name: Jezebel
jezebel.com.notes: Jezebel is not really a political news source.  It is more opinion based that is focused on entertainment news.  Jezebel is biased in favor of liberal causes through story choices and wording.

lavendermagazine.com.name: Lavender Magazine
lavendermagazine.com.notes: Lavender is a biweekly magazine, part of Lavender Media, published in Minneapolis, Minnesota for the gay, lesbian, bisexual, and transgender community (Wikipedia). Lavender has a liberal political affiliation through story choices and is well sourced.

leftaction.com.name: Left Action
leftaction.com.notes: Left Action is a network of over 1,000,000 activists committed to making a difference and fighting for progressive causes. Sporadically provides news that mostly factual with left bias in wording and reporting.

lgbtqnation.com.name: LGBTQ Nation
lgbtqnation.com.notes: LGBTQ Nation is an online news magazine, reporting on issues relevant to the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer community. LGBTQ Nation is factually sourced and uses minimal loaded words. Has a strong left wing political affiliation through story choices and advocacy.

liberalamerica.org.name: Liberal America
liberalamerica.org.notes: Liberal America claims to be “the only place on the web that is devoted solely to all things liberal.”  This is a very fair claim and is accurate.  Content has a left wing bias.

liberalplug.com.name: Liberal Plug
liberalplug.com.notes: The Liberal Plug is a news and opinion website with extreme left wing bias. Some stories appear to be outright fake news. Most others are not properly sourced and amount to left wing propaganda. This source is not credible.

samuel-warde.com.name: Liberals Unite (Samuel Warde)
samuel-warde.com.notes: Liberals Unite is a well established very liberally biased news and opinion website.  Liberals Unite has a strong left wing bias through reporting and word choices.

littlegreenfootballs.com.name: Little Green Footballs
littlegreenfootballs.com.notes: Little Green Footballs (LGF) is an American political blog run by web designer Charles Johnson. In its beginning years, the site had a right-wing orientation and known for its advocacy of the War on Terrorism and the Iraq War, as well its strident criticism of political Islam. The blog moved away from the right around 2009 (Wikipedia). Currently, the blog has a left-wing bias in reporting and story choices. They also occasionally publish unverified stories such as this one.

mediaite.com.name: Mediaite
mediaite.com.notes: Mediaite is a liberal news and opinion blog covering politics and entertainment in the media industry. It is the flagship blog of Abrams Media, a ring of blogs run by ABC legal analyst Dan Abrams.  Has typical left wing bias in reporting and presentation.

mediamatters.org.name: Media Matters
mediamatters.org.notes: Media Matters for America is a politically progressive media watchdog in the United States. The organization has a stated mission of “comprehensively monitoring, analyzing, and correcting conservative misinformation in the U.S. media”. Set up as a tax-exempt, nonprofit organization, MMfA was founded in 2004 by journalist and political activist David Brock as a counterweight to the conservative Media Research Center. It is known for its aggressive criticism of conservative journalists and media outlets, including its “War on Fox News (Wikipedia).” According to Politifact Media Matters has been factual in reporting.

medium.com.name: Medium
medium.com.notes: Medium is an online publishing platform developed by Twitter co-founder Evan Williams, and launched in August 2012. It is legally owned by A Medium Corporation. The platform is an example of evolved social journalism, having a hybrid collection of amateur and professional people and publications, or exclusive blogs or publishers on Medium and is regularly regarded as a blog host (Wikipedia). We really are not sure where to place this source.  Medium has a variety of writers from many different political perspectives.  We sampled 10 top stories and 6 out of 10 leaned left. That doesn’t mean it represents the entirety of the site.  We gave this source a mixed factual reporting rating because many authors on Medium are not journalists.

modernliberals.com.name: Modern Liberals
modernliberals.com.notes: A website dedicated to liberal news.  Also, has some liberal satire and opinion pieces.

motherjones.com.name: Mother Jones
motherjones.com.notes: Mother Jones is a politically progressive American magazine reporting on politics, the environment, human rights, and culture.  Mother Jones is published by the Foundation for National Progress (FNP), a nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization (Wikipedia).

front.moveon.org.name: Move On
front.moveon.org.notes: MoveOn.org is an American, non-profit, progressive public policy advocacy group and political action committee. Formed in 1998 in response to the impeachment of President Bill Clinton by the U.S. House of Representatives, MoveOn.org has raised millions of dollars for candidates it identifies as “progressives” in the United States (Wikipedia).  Strong left wing bias with reporting and has an unproven claim according to Snopes.

msnbc.com.name: MSNBC
msnbc.com.notes: MSNBC is an American basic cable and satellite television network that provides news coverage and political commentary from NBC News on current events (Wikipedia).  Has left wing bias in reporting and wording.  MSNBC has also made some false claims according to Politifact.

nationofchange.org.name: Nation of Change
nationofchange.org.notes: Nation of Change is a 501(c) nonprofit news and activism organization founded in 2011 and based out of Albuquerque, New Mexico. Nation of Change provides a free daily newsletter with articles from progressive writers and initiates activist calls to action. Nation of Change does not always support the consensus of science.

newint.org.name: New Internationalist
newint.org.notes: Established in 1973.  New Internationalist (NI) is an independent, non-profit, publishing co-operative, based in Oxford, United Kingdom. Predominantly known for its monthly independent magazine, it describes itself as existing to ‘cover stories the mainstream media sidestep and provide alternative perspectives on today’s global critical issues (Wikipedia).  Typical left wing positions and bias through reporting.

newleftreview.org.name: New Left Review
newleftreview.org.notes: The New Left Review is a bimonthly political academic journal covering world politics, economy, and culture which was established in 1960. In 2003, the magazine ranked 12th by impact factor on a list of the top 20 political science journals in the world (Wikipedia). Has very high standards of journalism with a moderate left bias in reporting.

newpol.org.name: New Politics Magazine
newpol.org.notes: New Politics is an independent socialist journal founded in 1961.  While it is inclusive of articles from a variety of left-of-center positions, the publication leans strongly toward a democratic Marxist perspective, placing it typically to the left of the liberal or social democratic views (Wikipedia). Strong journalism and factually sourced.

newrepublic.com.name: New Republic
newrepublic.com.notes: The New Republic is a liberal American magazine of commentary on politics and the arts published since 1914, with major influence on American political and cultural thinking. Founded in 1914 by major leaders of the Progressive Movement it attempted to find a balance between a progressivism focused on humanitarianism and moral passion, and on the other hand sought a basis in scientific analysis of social issues (Wikipedia). New Republic has produced quality journalism for a century.

newstatesman.com.name: New Statesman
newstatesman.com.notes: The New Statesman is a British political and cultural magazine published in London. Founded as a weekly review of politics and literature on 12 April 1913, it was connected then with Sidney and Beatrice Webb and other leading members of the socialist Fabian Society. The magazine has, according to its present self-description, a left-of-centre political position.  (Wikipedia) By USA standards this source is considered left.

nymag.com.name: New York Magazine
nymag.com.notes: Established in 1968. New York is a bi-weekly magazine concerned with life, culture, politics, and style generally, and with a particular emphasis on New York City (Wikipedia). NY Mag reports with a left biased, but is always sourced and factual in news reporting.

newyorker.com.name: New Yorker
newyorker.com.notes: The New Yorker is an American magazine of reportage, commentary, criticism, essays, fiction, satire, cartoons, and poetry. It is published by Condé Nast. Started as a weekly in 1925, the magazine is now published 47 times annually, with five of these issues covering two-week spans (Wikipedia). The New York is trustworthy for factual accuracy, but with a left wing bias in wording and report choices.

newscorpse.com.name: News Corpse
newscorpse.com.notes: News Corpse’s mission is expose corporate media.  They embrace independent media, but with a left wing bias.  They also do not shy from an occasional conspiracy theory.  Fact check this source.

newshounds.us.name: NewsHounds
newshounds.us.notes: A website dedicated to exposing Fox News in lies and misreporting.  Has a left wing bias and sometimes takes information out of context.

newslogue.com.name: NewsLogue
newslogue.com.notes: Newslogue is highly biased towards liberal and progressive views. The articles are worded and weighted very heavily towards the left and read more like op-eds instead of news articles.  The articles are penned primarily by Caitlin Johnson, and the site appears more like a personal blog than a news site. As such, the articles aren’t always entirely factual either.  Example, in their article “The Right Has No Answer For Automation Job Loss, But The Left Does” the author maintains that the right is against a Universal Basic Income. Even a simple search reveals that there is indeed bipartisan support for it. (D. Kelley)

nowthisnews.com.name: NowThis News
nowthisnews.com.notes: NowThis News was founded by Huffington Post co-founder and former chairman Kenneth Lerer and former Huffington Post CEO Eric Hippeau. Uses Facebook, Snapchat, Twitter, Instagram, Vine, Tumblr, and YouTube as primary outlets. Political news reports have a strong liberal/progressive leaning bias, heavily relying on meme culture and soundbites, often omitting certain key facts spoken in videos clips (Wikipedia).

palmerreport.com.name: Palmer Report
palmerreport.com.notes: The Palmer Report is a news and opinion website created by Bill Palmer a current writer and owner of Daily News Bin.  The Palmer Report is typically well sourced and usually points to credible sources.  However, there is a very strong liberal bias in reporting and story content.  The Palmer Report uses loaded words and sensational headlines that don’t always reflect the content of the article. An example headline is as follows: Donald Trump’s demented “Happy New Year” tweet is the worst thing you’ll read all year. The Palmer Report has been criticized by the Slate for publishing misinformation.

pastemagazine.com.name: Paste Magazine
pastemagazine.com.notes: Paste is a monthly music and entertainment digital magazine published in the United States by Wolfgang’s Vault. Its tagline is “Signs of Life in Music, Film and Culture.” It ran as a print publication from 2002 to 2010 before converting to online-only. (Wikipedia) While Paste Magazine is primarily a Music and entertainment magazine it does have a political section with typical left wing bias. It utilizes strong loaded words that are pro-liberal and anti-conservative.  The source is factual in reporting on political news, but has a left wing editorial position.

people.com.name: People Magazine
people.com.notes: People is an American weekly magazine of celebrity and human-interest stories, published by Time Inc. With a readership of 46.6 million adults, People has the largest audience of any American magazine (Wikipedia).  The online version of People Magazine has a politics section that has a moderate left wing bias through wording and story selection.

photographyisnotacrime.com.name: PINAC
photographyisnotacrime.com.notes: Photography is Not a Crime, abbreviated to PINAC and published under the trade names PINAC News, is an organization and news website that focuses on rights of civilians who photograph and film police misconduct and other similar activities in the United States incorporated in June 2014 as PINAC Inc. a Florida not for profit corporation. It was founded in 2007 following the arrest of its creator, Carlos Miller, a veteran news reporter and photojournalist. PINAC focuses on First Amendment issues that intersect with governmental oppression of those rights, normally by police officers. It also gives civilians tips on how to interact with the police and assert their constitutionally protected rights. (Wikipedia) This source uses loaded words in their headlines, but they source their information well.

pinknews.co.uk.name: Pink News
pinknews.co.uk.notes: Pink News is a UK-based online newspaper marketed to the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community (LGBT).  They have a left wing opinion bias, however their reporting is strong and mostly evidence based.

politicalupdater.com.name: Political Updater
politicalupdater.com.notes: Political Updater is a news and opinion website that reports with loaded words and not always well sourced information.  While the site does seem to report both left and right stories there seem to be more that favor the left in our sampling.

politicususa.com.name: PoliticusUSA
politicususa.com.notes: PolitiusUsa is an overtly left wing biased news and opinion website.  They use strong loaded words and sensationalized headlines to get attention.  While PoliticusUsa does attempt to source their information, they sometimes link to other very biased sites. The stories on this website need to be read with caution and be prepared to fact check.

pravdareport.com.name: Pravda Report
pravdareport.com.notes: Pravda Reports is a far left communist newspaper from Russia. It does not always report accurately about USA and other international news.

pressprogress.ca.name: Press Progress
pressprogress.ca.notes: Press Progress, an online news and analysis website, is a project of the Broadbent Institute which seeks to provide an online Progressive Political news source. Press Progress has a left bias in reporting stories and uses moderately loaded word choices. They do however, link to mostly credible sources.

proudemocrat.com.name: Proud Democrat
proudemocrat.com.notes: I am pretty sure you have gathered the bias by the name alone.  There is a very strong left wing bias here.  They occasionally produce good content, but they also fail to source sometimes to quality sources.

rabble.ca.name: Rabble.ca
rabble.ca.notes: Rabble.ca is an non-profit alternative Canadian online magazine founded in 2001. Rabble.ca works in partnership with the Canadian Centre for Policy Alternatives and the Centre for Social Justice. It features podcasts, videos and an discussion board called babble (Wikipedia). Rabble uses a lot of loaded language in the headlines, and within the articles. Mostly in commentaries they describe themselves as “blurring the line between readers and contributors, providing a space for issues exploring political passions and an opportunity to expand ideas”. They are an openly progressive site, reporting and commenting on current news with a clear left bias. (F. Locke Siewert)

rawstory.com.name: Raw Story
rawstory.com.notes: The Raw Story is an American online news organization founded in 2004 by John Byrne. It covers current national and international political and economic news and publishes its own editorials and investigative pieces. The Raw Story describes itself as progressive, bringing attention to stories that it sees as downplayed or ignored by other media outlets. (Wikipedia)  Raw Story demonstrates typical left wing bias and occasionally goes against scientific consensus on some issues.

realtimepolitics.com.name: Real Time Politics
realtimepolitics.com.notes: Far left wing bias.  Loose on facts and publishes common left wing conspiracies against conservatives.  Not a trustworthy source.

redpepper.org.uk.name: Red Pepper
redpepper.org.uk.notes: Red Pepper is an independent “radical red and green” magazine based in the UK.  Has strong socialist biases, but is well sourced.

rewire.news.name: Rewire
rewire.news.notes: Rewire is a website focused on reproductive and sexual health from a pro-reproductive rights perspective. The website began as a UN Foundation blog in 2006, and became its own nonprofit organization in January 2012.  Although the site has a left wing political perspective it does offer mostly evidence based information.

revcom.us.name: Revcom.us
revcom.us.notes: Revcom.us is the voice of the Revolutionary Communist Party of the USA.  With that said is has a strong Communist bias.  It uses strong loaded words to describe other political parties.  The sole purpose of the site is to promote Communism.

reverbpress.com.name: Reverb Press
reverbpress.com.notes: Reverb Press is a news and lifestyle webzine with a left wing bias in reporting and wording.  They do source their information, but sometimes to unreliable sources.

revolution-news.com.name: Revolution News
revolution-news.com.notes: All journalists are independent.  Published stories typically have a moderate left wing bias and usually sourced.

rightwingwatch.org.name: Right Wing Watch
rightwingwatch.org.notes: Right Wing Watch keeps track of a variety of organizations, but the groups they track do tend to be conservative extremist in one regard or another.  This source does occasionally take statements out of context.  Needs to be fact checked.

trofire.com.name: Ring of Fire
trofire.com.notes: Ring of Fire is a nationally syndicated American talk radio program that has Overt left wing bias. Each host has their own style and level of bias, but most source reliable sources in their reporting.  They do however, take many things out of context.

salon.com.name: Salon
salon.com.notes: Salon is a progressive/liberal website created by David Talbot in 1995 and part of Salon Media Group. It focuses on U.S. politics and current affairs.  Salon has has left wing bias through reporting and wording, but can be trusted to source to mostly credible information.

shareblue.com.name: Shareblue
shareblue.com.notes: Shareblue is an online political news source.  It is affiliated with Blue Nation Review and David Brock.  This source, like Blue Nation Review has a strong left wing bias in story selection and wording. Shareblue also occasionally publishes stories that are propagandist and misleading factually.

slate.com.name: Slate
slate.com.notes: Slate is an English-language online current affairs, politics and culture magazine in the United States that trends towards a liberal viewpoint (Wikipedia).

worldsocialism.org.name: Socialist Standard
worldsocialism.org.notes: Socialist Standard is a monthly socialist magazine published without interruption since September 1904 by the Socialist Party of Great Britain. The magazine is written in a simple, direct style and focuses mainly on socialist advocacy and Marxian analysis of current events, particularly those affecting the United Kingdom (Wikipedia).

sourcewatch.org.name: SourceWatch
sourcewatch.org.notes: SourceWatch aims to produce a directory of public relations firms, think tanks, industry-funded organizations and industry-friendly experts that work to influence public opinion and public policy on behalf of corporations, governments and special interest groups (Wikileaks).  Reporting favors liberal media.

stpete4peace.org.name: St. Pete for Peace
stpete4peace.org.notes: Chris Ernesto (born October 16, 1963) is a founding member of St. Pete for Peace, a non-partisan antiwar organization providing peace oriented education events and services to the Tampa Bay, FL community since 2003. He created and manages the StPeteForPeace.org, OccupyArrests.com and USinAfrica.com websites. Ernesto has also organized numerous demonstrations, published multiple articles and videos, and is a lead researcher for St. Pete for Peace where he has developed dozens of fact sheets (Wikipedia). St. Pete for Peace has a left wing political bias, however, they do source well, although at times to other left wing sources. Otherwise, this is a pretty trustworthy source for anti-war information.

talkingpointsmemo.com.name: Talking Points Memo
talkingpointsmemo.com.notes: Talking Points Memo (or TPM) is a liberal web-based political journalism website created and run by Josh Marshall, a journalist, liberal blogger and historian. It debuted on November 12, 2000. TPM has liberal bias in story selection and produces some very credible journalism and are pretty good at sourcing.

takepart.com.name: TakePart
takepart.com.notes: TakePart produces a Web site with a daily cycle of original articles, blogs, and videos on the culture and lifestyle of change. Topics of coverage include animals, arts, food, education, the environment, green tech, politics, culture, health and innovation (Wikipedia).

prospect.org.name: The American Prospect
prospect.org.notes: The American Prospect is a quarterly American political magazine dedicated to American liberalism. Based in Washington, D.C., The American Prospect says it aims “to advance liberal and progressive goals through reporting, analysis, and debate about today’s realities and tomorrow’s possibilities (Wikipedia).”  The American Prospect is generally well sourced.

blue-route.org.name: The Blue Route
blue-route.org.notes: The Blue Route is a news and opinion website with strong left wing bias in reporting and emotional word use.  Does not always source to credible information.

thecanary.co.name: The Canary (UK)
thecanary.co.notes: The Canary is a left-wing political blog in the United Kingdom.  The Canary uses strong loaded words with a left-wing bias.  They are evidence based and provide sources for claims.  They typically report only one side of the story and have a strong liberal political affiliation.

thedailybanter.com.name: The Daily Banter
thedailybanter.com.notes: The Daily Banter is an online news and opinion site.  It produces well written articles that must be filtered through their liberal bias on most stories. Most information is sourced.

thedailyvox.co.za.name: The Daily Vox
thedailyvox.co.za.notes: The Daily Vox is a South African news and opinion website. They present news with slightly loaded words that have a left wing bias. Most articles are well sourced.

thefrisky.com.name: The Frisky
thefrisky.com.notes: The Frisky is a women’s entertainment and lifestyle website which was launched in 2008. When covering political news they have a left wing bias with loaded words and story selection. Though biased they do source to credible information.

thegrio.com.name: TheGrio
thegrio.com.notes: TheGrio is an American website with news, opinion, entertainment and video content geared toward African Americans. TheGrio is one of the largest news sources for black America. Originally launched in June 2009 as a division of NBC News, it became a division of MSNBC in 2013.  (Wikipedia) Covers a lot of entertainment news, but also does cover politics with a left wing bias.

themilitant.com.name: The Militant
themilitant.com.notes: The Militant is an international Socialist newsweekly connected to the Socialist Workers Party (SWP) and the Pathfinder Press. It is published in the United States and distributed in other countries such as Canada, the United Kingdom, Australia, France, Sweden, Iceland, and New Zealand (Wikipedia). Has a left wing socialist bias in reporting, but does not use loaded words and sources well.

morningstaronline.co.uk.name: The Morning Star
morningstaronline.co.uk.notes: Morning Star is a left-wing British daily tabloid newspaper with a focus on social, political and trade union issues. Articles and comment columns are contributed by writers from socialist, communist, social democratic, green and religious perspectives (Wikipedia). Uses strong words with a liberal bias and has sensational headlines.  Mostly links to credible sources.

thenation.com.name: The Nation
thenation.com.notes: The Nation is the oldest continuously published weekly magazine in the United States, and the most widely read weekly journal of progressive political and cultural news, opinion and analysis (Wikipedia). Founded in 1865, The Nation produces well written journalism and is factual and sourced.  They have a typical left wing bias in story choices and wording.

thenewcivilrightsmovement.com.name: The New Civil Rights Movement
thenewcivilrightsmovement.com.notes: A website news source that promotes civil rights for LGBT people.  Has strong left biased language regarding conservatives.

other98.com.name: The Other 98%
other98.com.notes: The Other 98% is a non-profit activist group that are “tired of corporate control of our government, our institutions, and our planet.”  Their primary mission is to get money out of politics and reduce corporate influence.  They present information with a left wing bias regarding reporting and wording.  They also have a mixed file from Politifact.

progressive.org.name: The Progressive
progressive.org.notes: The Progressive is an American monthly magazine of politics, culture and progressivism with a pronounced liberal perspective. Founded in 1909 by Senator Robert “Fighting Bob” La Follette, it was originally called La Follette’s Weekly and then simply La Follette’s. In 1929, it was recapitalized and had its name changed to The Progressive (Wikipedia).

theroot.com.name: The Root
theroot.com.notes: The Root is an English-language American online magazine of African-American culture launched on January 28, 2008, by Henry Louis Gates, Jr. and Donald E. Graham, and was owned by Graham Holdings Company (Wikipedia). Solid evidence based reporting with a left wing bias in wording and political affiliation.

villagevoice.com.name: The Village Voice
villagevoice.com.notes: The Village Voice was created in 1955 as a platform for the creative community. As the nation’s first alternative newsweekly, The Village Voice introduced free-form, high-spirited, and passionate journalism into the public discourse. The recipient of three Pulitzer Prizes, the National Press Foundation Award and the George Polk Award, The Village Voice remains a go-to source for coverage of New York’s politics and vast cultural landscape.  (Wikipedia) The Village Voice produces high quality journalism and sources political information well.  It does however have a left wing bias in what it reports and the use of emotional (loaded) words.

thewalrus.ca.name: The Walrus
thewalrus.ca.notes: The Walrus is a Canadian general interest magazine which publishes long-form journalism on Canadian and international affairs, along with fiction and poetry by Canadian writers (Wikipedia). High quality liberal journalism.

thinkprogress.org.name: Think Progress
thinkprogress.org.notes: ThinkProgress is an American political news blog. It is a project of the Center for American Progress, a progressive public policy research and advocacy organization. Has a left wing bias in story selection and has failed some fact checks including these from Snopes.

this.org.name: This Magazine
this.org.notes: This Magazine is an independent alternative Canadian political magazine. Has a left wing bias in story selection and is usually factually sourced.

towleroad.com.name: Towleroad
towleroad.com.notes: Towleroad is blog founded by Andy Towle and is based in New York City. Towle, who is gay, started his blog Towleroad in 2003.  The blog operates with little regard for facts and instead publishes sensationalist headlines (Wikipedia).

tribunemagazine.org.name: Tribune Magazine UK
tribunemagazine.org.notes: Tribune is a democratic socialist fortnightly newspaper, founded in 1937 and published in London. It has always been independent but has usually supported the Labour Party from the left. Has a left wing political bias, but is well sourced to credible information.

truthdig.com.name: Truthdig
truthdig.com.notes: Truthdig is a news website that provides a mix of long-form articles, interviews, and blog-like commentary on current events, delivered from a politically progressive point of view (Wikipedia).  Truthdig has a left wing bias in what they choose to report and the words they use, but the articles are generally well written and reasonably sourced.

truth-out.org.name: Truth Out
truth-out.org.notes: Truthout is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, progressive news organization in the United States that operates a web site and distributes a daily newsletter. Registered in September 2001, in Sacramento, California, Truthout publishes original political news articles, opinion pieces, video reports and artwork. According to its web site, Truthout works to broaden and diversify the political discussion by introducing independent voices and focusing on under covered issues and unconventional thinking (Wikipedia). Truthout has a strong left wing bias in reporting choices and wording.  They also have reported some stories that were not factual.  For example, a reporter claimed that Karl Rove was indicted on charges when in fact he wasn’t.  The reporter continued to make the claim without evidence.  See link here.  Although this is only one example it shows that this source should be checked when in doubt.

uproxx.com.name: Uproxx
uproxx.com.notes: Uproxx is an American digital media company that covers entertainment and culture. It was founded in 2008 by Jarret Myer and Brian Brater and acquired by Woven Digital in 2014. The site’s target audience is males aged 18-34 (Wikipedia). Has a left wing political affiliation in reporting.

upworthy.com.name: Upworthy
upworthy.com.notes: Upworthy is a website for viral content started in March 2012 by Eli Pariser, the former executive director of MoveOn, and Peter Koechley, the former managing editor of The Onion. It uses virality to promote stories with a progressive bent on political and social issues (Wikipedia). Upworthy claims to fact check every post, we couldn’t find anything to dispute this.

theuspoliticalpost.com.name: US Political Post
theuspoliticalpost.com.notes: US Politcal Post is a News and Opinion blog with left wing bias in reporting.  As of 12/22/16 this source does not appear to be active any longer.

usuncut.com.name: US Uncut
usuncut.com.notes: US Uncut has overt left wing bias in story selection and wording.  Does not have an about or mission page to explain its positions. Does not provide biographies for its writers.  Not all articles are well sourced and are highly sensationalized. Requires fact checking against reliable sources.

vanityfair.com.name: Vanity Fair
vanityfair.com.notes: Vanity Fair is a magazine of popular culture, fashion, and current affairs published by Condé Nast (Wikipedia).  Vanity Fair also publishes political content that has a moderate left wing bias.  This is seen in several articles critical of conservatives and positive in favor of more liberal politicians.  Overall, Vanity Fair is well written and mostly factual, but there is a clear left wing bias.

vox.com.name: Vox
vox.com.notes: Vox is an American advocacy news website run by Vox Media, co-founded by liberal columnists Ezra Klein, Melissa Bell, and Matt Yglesias and launched in April 2014.  Typical left wing bias in reporting and story choices.

washingtonmonthly.com.name: Washington Monthly
washingtonmonthly.com.notes: Washington Monthly is a bimonthly nonprofit magazine of United States politics and government that is based in Washington, D.C. Has a liberal bias in reporting and word choices.

winningdemocrats.com.name: Winning Democrats
winningdemocrats.com.notes: Winning Democrats is an over the top extreme left wing website.  Demonstrates severe bias in wording and story choices.  Has a very poor record of factual reporting.

wonkette.com.name: Wonkette
wonkette.com.notes: Wonkette is a news and opinion website with a very strong liberal bias.  They sometimes post tongue in cheek articles that can be misleading.  Overall, they source their information and will correct factual errors when they occur.  Although they are very biased in their wording and content they are reliable for information.

tytnetwork.com.name: The Young Turks
tytnetwork.com.notes: The Young Turks (TYT) is an American political commentary web series that was created by journalist Cenk Uygur, Ben Mankiewicz and Dave Koller. Currently co-hosted by Uygur and Ana Kasparian, its stance is progressive/left-wing; although its primary focus is on political commentary, the program provides opinion on topics of varying news genres.  Although very left biased in delivery the Young Turks do a decent job of sourcing their information with credibility.

zcomm.org.name: Z Magazine
zcomm.org.notes: Z Magazine was established in 1987. It is published in print and on-line. Contributors to the magazine include Noam Chomsky, Edward S. Herman, Mike Kuhlenbeck, Jack Rasmas, Paul Street and Kevin Zeese.  Has a distinct Libertarian-Socialist-Anarchist Bias.

abcnews.go.com.name: ABC News
abcnews.go.com.notes: ABC News is the news division of the American Broadcasting Company (ABC), owned by the Disney Media Networks division of The Walt Disney Company.  Like most so called “Mainstream” media sources ABC has been accused of liberal bias.  In reality, ABC is mostly trustworthy with a left of center bias.

abovethelaw.com.name: Above the Law
abovethelaw.com.notes: Above the Law (often abbreviated ATL) is a news website about law, law schools, and the legal profession. Established in 2006, the site is owned and published by Breaking Media (Wikipedia). Uses minimal loaded words, is sourced and factual in reporting. Story selection has a left-center bias.

aeon.co.name: Aeon
aeon.co.notes: Aeon is a digital magazine of ideas and culture. Publishing new articles every weekday, Aeon describes itself as a publication which “asks the biggest questions and finds the freshest, most original answers, provided by world-leading authorities on science, philosophy and society (Wikipedia).” Aeon also covers news and politics with a slight left-center bias in reporting choices, is factually sourced and uses minimal emotional wording. (D. Van Zandt)

aljazeera.com.name: Al Jazeera
aljazeera.com.notes: Al Jazeera is a Doha-based state-funded broadcaster owned by the Al Jazeera Media Network, which is partly funded by the House of Thani, the ruling family of Qatar. Initially launched as an Arabic news and current affairs satellite TV channel, Al Jazeera has since expanded into a network with several outlets, including the Internet and specialty TV channels in multiple languages. Al Jazeera is among the largest news organizations with 80 bureaus around the world. Al Jazeera is owned by the government of Qatar and has pro-Qatari bias. (Wikipedia) However, Al Jazeera uses low bias when reporting USA news.

al-monitor.com.name: Al Monitor
al-monitor.com.notes: Al-Monitor is a media site launched in February 2012 by the Arab American entrepreneur Jamal Daniel and based in Washington, DC. Al-Monitor provides reporting and analysis from and about the Middle East through both original and translated content. (Wikipedia) Al Monitor is well sourced, credible and factual.  Has a left of center bias politically.

guttmacher.org.name: Alan Guttmacher Institute
guttmacher.org.notes: Is a leading research and policy organization committed to advancing sexual and reproductive health and rights in the United States.  Left of Center politically, but excellent sourcing and factual information.

adn.com.name: Alaska Dispatch News
adn.com.notes: The Alaska Dispatch News is a daily newspaper published by the Alaska Dispatch, and based in Anchorage, Alaska. The newspaper has won the Pulitzer Prize twice in the “Public Service” category, in 1976 and 1989. (Wikipedia)

timesunion.com.name: Albany Times-Union
timesunion.com.notes: The Albany Times Union is an American daily newspaper, serving the Capital Region of New York, United States. Although the newspaper focuses on Albany and its suburbs, it covers all parts of the four-county area, including the cities of Troy, Schenectady and Saratoga Springs.

ohio.com.name: Akron Beacon Journal
ohio.com.notes: The Akron Beacon Journal is a morning newspaper in Akron, Ohio, United States, and published by Black Press. It is the sole daily newspaper in Akron and is distributed throughout Northeast Ohio. The paper places a strong emphasis on local news and business.

aclu.org.name: American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU)
aclu.org.notes: The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) is a nonpartisan, non-profit, organization  whose stated mission is “to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties guaranteed to every person in this country by the Constitution and laws of the United States.” It works through litigation, lobbying, and community empowerment (Wikipedia). The ACLU in their blog section and even news section often cite to places like the Huffington Post for news articles but sometimes they will use basic reporting like AP or Reuters. Beyond their news and blog posts most of the site covers issues that are often considered more liberal causes but most often it is consistent with their stance on the rights they champion. The ACLU has defended the KKK, Pro Abortion, and Neo-Nazi’s right to assemble and protest (1 2 3).  They will often be accused of being left biased as they do not advocate for gun rights, however they equally do not champion gun regulations either.  A quick search for Gun Rights or even Guns will yield no results or results only related to search and seizure cases they have taken on.  They do not agree on the individuals rights to own firearms but do not advocate on their beliefs.  They have teamed up with the NRA several times in a sort of odd fellowship (4). Their Blog & News feed’s can often be filled with more left leaning stances, but they are not biased in their case work load or defending the rights they advocate for. There have been times Justice Scalia the most outspoken and most conservative justice at the time had ideas that line up with the ACLU (5). Most modern conservatives may often take issue with much of what the ACLU advocates and litigates in courts. However, the ACLU has defended religious freedoms in the school as well. Including the right to pray in school (6). I would try to advocate that the ACLU is more neutral than left, but with the major shift in American politics to the right, I can no longer advocate that stance. (M. Allen)

ahtribune.com.name: American Herald Tribune
ahtribune.com.notes: The American Herald Tribune is an online independent news source.  The American Herald Tribune produces quality journalism that is factually based.  Has a left-center bias in content and reporting.

adl.org.name: Anti-Defamation League
adl.org.notes: The Anti-Defamation League is an international Jewish non-governmental organization based in the United States. Describing itself as “the nation’s premier civil rights/human relations agency,” the ADL states that it “fights anti-Semitism and all forms of bigotry, defends democratic ideals and protects civil rights for all,” doing so through “information, education, legislation, and advocacy.”  (Wikipedia) Has been accused of having a liberal political bias.

aranews.net.name: Ara News
aranews.net.notes: ARA News is a Syrian independent press agency concerned with covering local developments across Syria, including its Kurdish region.

tucson.com.name: Arizona Daily Star
tucson.com.notes: The Arizona Daily Star is the major morning daily newspaper that serves Tucson and surrounding districts of southern Arizona in the United States.

citizen-times.com.name: Asheville Citizen-Times
citizen-times.com.notes: The Asheville Citizen-Times is a major daily newspaper from Asheville, North Carolina. Is well sourced with just a slight left of center bias in news coverage.

ajc.com.name: Atlanta Journal-Constitution
ajc.com.notes: The Atlanta Journal-Constitution (AJC) is the only major daily newspaper in the metropolitan area of Atlanta, Georgia, United States. The AJC is factual and sourced in reporting with a left of center editorial stance.

theatlantic.com.name: The Atlantic
theatlantic.com.notes: The Atlantic is an American magazine, founded in 1857 as The Atlantic Monthly in Boston, Massachusetts. Since 2006, the magazine is based in Washington, D.C. Created as a literary and cultural commentary magazine, it has grown to achieve a national reputation as a high-quality review organ with a moderate worldview. The periodical has won more National Magazine Awards than any other monthly magazine (Wikipedia). Has a slight of liberal bias in reporting coverage, put produces exceptional journalism that is sourced and factual.

axios.com.name: Axios
axios.com.notes: AXIOS Media or Axios is a news and information company started in 2016 by Politico co-founder Jim VandeHei, former Chief White House correspondent at Politico, Mike Allen, and former Politico Chief Revenue Officer Roy Schwartz (Wikipedia). Axios is well sourced and factual. Has a left-Center political bias in story selection.

baltimoresun.com.name: Baltimore Sun
baltimoresun.com.notes: The Baltimore Sun is the largest general-circulation daily newspaper based in the American state of Maryland and provides coverage of local and regional news, events, issues, people, and industries. Founded in 1837, it is owned by Tronc, Inc (Wikipedia). The Baltimore Sun is well sourced and factual with a left wing editorial bias.

baptistnews.com.name: Baptist News Global
baptistnews.com.notes: Baptist News Global is an independent Baptist news agency. It was founded in 2014 as a merger of Associated Baptist Press (ABP), which was founded in 1990, and the Religious Herald, which was founded in 1828 (Wikipedia).  Baptist News Global publishes curated news from many least biased, left-center and left wing sources.  They also publish their own news that has minimal bias.  Politically this source aligns in the left-center.  Information is well sourced and trustworthy.

bbc.com.name: BBC
bbc.com.notes: The British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) is a British public service broadcaster. It is headquartered at Broadcasting House in London, and is the world’s oldest national broadcasting organisation and the largest broadcaster in the world by number of employees. (Wikipedia) The BBC is an outstanding journalistic source.  They have just a slight left of center political bias.

bjreview.com.name: Beijing Review
bjreview.com.notes: Founded in March 1958 as the weekly Peking Review, it was an important tool for the People’s Republic of China government to communicate to the rest of world. Has a Communist, Maoist perspective, but reports new factually.

berkshireeagle.com.name: Berkshire Eagle
berkshireeagle.com.notes: The Berkshire Eagle is an American daily newspaper published in Pittsfield, Massachusetts, and covering all of Berkshire County, as well as four New York communities near Pittsfield. It is considered a newspaper of record for Berkshire County, Massachusetts (Wikipedia). Factual with a Left-Center editorial bias.

bloomberg.com.name: Bloomberg
bloomberg.com.notes: Bloomberg  is an American weekly business magazine published by Bloomberg L.P. Bloomberg was founded in 1929, the magazine was created to provide information and interpretation about what was happening in the business world (Wikipedia). Primarily covers financial news, but does cover politics with slight left wing bias in reporting.

bluestemprairie.com.name: Bluestem Prairie
bluestemprairie.com.notes: Bluestem Prairie publishes articles and opinion by writers living in Greater Minnesota. Bias varies by writer ranging from left to low bias. Overall, the source presents with a left-center bias that favors progressive causes. They source well, but some do use loaded words to convey their message.

bostonglobe.com.name: Boston Globe
bostonglobe.com.notes: The Boston Globe is an American daily newspaper based in Boston, Massachusetts.  The Boston Globe has been awarded 23 Pulitzer Prizes since 1966 (Wikipedia). The Boston Globe is one of the largest newspapers in the USA.  Factual with a left of center editorial bias.

bgr.com.name: Boy Genius Report (BGR)
bgr.com.notes: Boy Genius Report (also referred to as BGR) is a technology-influenced website that covers topics ranging from consumer gadgets, to entertainment, gaming, and science. BGR also covers politics as it relates to technology with a left of center bias in reporting.

brookings.edu.name: Brookings Institute
brookings.edu.notes: The Brookings Institution is a century-old American research group. It conducts research and education in the social sciences, primarily in economics, metropolitan policy, governance, foreign policy, and global economy and development. Has a left of center political bias in reporting with factual sourced content.

buffalonews.com.name: Buffalo News
buffalonews.com.notes: The Buffalo News is the daily newspaper of the Buffalo – Niagara Falls metropolitan area. The paper is owned by Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway. Journalists for The Buffalo News and The Buffalo Evening News have won four Pulitzer Prizes. Factual news reporting with a left of center editorial bias.

businessinsider.com.name: Business Insider
businessinsider.com.notes: Business Insider is a German owned American news website that has a left of center bias in reporting.  Well sourced. Has been critcized for clickbait style.

bustle.com.name: Bustle Magazine
bustle.com.notes: Bustle is an online US women’s magazine founded in August 2013.  Bustle covers a variety of topics including political news that has a left of center bias based on story selection and a few loaded words.

buzzfeed.com.name: Buzzfeed
buzzfeed.com.notes: Buzzfeed is an internet media company that focuses on entertainment, but does have content for breaking news and politics. Buzzfeed occasionally uses loaded words with a left bias in headlines/articles and has failed some fact checks.

calgaryherald.com.name: Calgary Herald
calgaryherald.com.notes: The Calgary Herald is a Canadian daily newspaper published in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. Factual reporting, left of center editorial stance.

carolinapublicpress.org.name: Carolina Public Press
carolinapublicpress.org.notes: Carolina Public Press is North Carolina’s first online nonprofit news organization to be devoted to original, enterprise-level, in-depth and investigative journalism in the public interest. It’s also the only news organization in Western North Carolina to have credentialed journalists working in Raleigh as part of the Capitol Press Corps reporting on the N.C. General Assembly. Carolina Public Press has a left of center bias in reporting and political affiliation. Sources all information well.

cbc.ca.name: CBC News (Canadian Broadcasting)
cbc.ca.notes: CBC News is the division of the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation responsible for the news gathering and production of news programs on the corporation’s English-language operations, namely CBC Television, CBC Radio, CBC News Network, and CBC.ca. Founded in 1941, CBC News is the largest news broadcaster in Canada and has local, regional and national broadcasts and stations (Wikipedia). Has been accused of liberal bias, but it sourced and factual in news reporting.

cbsnews.com.name: CBS News
cbsnews.com.notes: CBS News is a mainstream USA media source.  CBS News has a left-center bias in reporting and is usually well sourced and factual.

cctv-america.com.name: CCTV America
cctv-america.com.notes: CCTV America is the American division of CCTV News, the English-language news channel run by Chinese state broadcaster China Central Television. It is based in Washington, DC and manages bureaus across North and South America. The service employs a mix of American, international and Chinese journalists and produces Americas-based programming with a focus on Asia for CCTV News (Wikipedia).

ciponline.org.name: Center for International Policy
ciponline.org.notes: The Center for International Policy (CIP) is a non-profit public policy research and advocacy think tank with offices in Washington, D.C. and New York City. It was founded in 1975 in response to the Vietnam War. The Center describes its mission as “promoting a U.S. foreign policy based on international cooperation, demilitarization and respect for human rights (Wikipedia). Has a Left-Center bias in reporting and political affiliation.  Sources to factual information.

wvgazettemail.com.name: Charleston Gazette-Mail
wvgazettemail.com.notes: The Charleston Gazette-Mail is the only daily morning newspaper in Charleston, West Virginia. It is the product of a July 2015 merger between the Charleston Gazette and the Charleston Daily Mail (Wikipedia). Factual, sourced news reporting with a liberal editorial bias.

charlotteobserver.com.name: Charlotte Observer
charlotteobserver.com.notes: The Charlotte Observer is a newspaper serving Charlotte, North Carolina, and its metro area. It has the largest circulation in North Carolina and South Carolina. It is owned by The McClatchy Company. Reports news factually with a left-center editorial bias.

chicagoreporter.com.name: The Chicago Reporter
chicagoreporter.com.notes: The Chicago Reporter is a monthly periodical based in Chicago, Illinois, USA. Founded in 1972, it covers poverty and race issues with a left-center bias in reporting.

chicago.suntimes.com.name: Chicago Sun Times
chicago.suntimes.com.notes: The Chicago Sun-Times is a daily newspaper published in Chicago, Illinois. It is the flagship paper of the Sun-Times Media Group. Reports news with valid sources.  Has a left-center editorial stance.

chicagotribune.com.name: Chicago Tribune
chicagotribune.com.notes: The Chicago Tribune is a daily newspaper based in Chicago, Illinois, United States, owned by tronc, Inc. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

legitgov.org.name: Citizens for Legitimate Government (CLG News)
legitgov.org.notes: Citizens for Legitimate Government claim to be a multi-partisan activist group established to expose and resist US imperialism, corpora-terrorism, and the New World Order (Wikipedia). They report a variety of political news and use pretty neutral language.  They do tend to veer slightly into conspiracies, but otherwise publishes short informative news.

ctj.org.name: Citizens for Tax Justice
ctj.org.notes: Citizens for Tax Justice is a progressive Washington, D.C.-based advocacy and lobbying think tank founded in 1979. CTJ’s work focuses primarily on federal tax policy.  CTJ is generally considered to be a left-wing organization, but its research has also been cited by Republican politicians and right-wing tax reform organizations when favorable to their policies (Wikipedia).

cnbc.com.name: CNBC
cnbc.com.notes: CNBC is an American basic cable, internet and satellite business news television channel that is owned by NBCUniversal News Group.  It primarily reports on financial news, but does cover politics and news headlines with a left-center bias.

cnn.com.name: CNN
cnn.com.notes: The Cable News Network (CNN) is an American basic cable and satellite television channel that is owned by the Turner Broadcasting System division of Time Warner.[1] It was founded in 1980 by American media proprietor Ted Turner as a 24-hour cable news channel; however, by April 2016, a CNN executive officially described the channel as “no longer a TV news network” and instead as “a 24-hour global multi-platform network (Wikipedia).” CNN has a left of center bias in reporting and sometimes uses sensational headlines.  CNN typically sources it’s news sources.

cjr.org.name: Columbia Journalism Review
cjr.org.notes: The Columbia Journalism Review (CJR) is an American magazine for professional journalists published by the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism since 1961. Its contents include news and media industry trends, analysis, professional ethics and stories behind news (Wikipedia).  Well sourced information.

commonwealthfund.org.name: Commonwealth Fund
commonwealthfund.org.notes: A private U.S. foundation whose stated purpose is to “promote a high performing health care system that achieves better access.  Founded in 1918. Evidence based reporting with a left of center political affiliation.

credoaction.com.name: Credo Action
credoaction.com.notes: Credo Action is a part of the Credo Mobile Network, which has created an online network of more than 3 million activists who take actions both online and offline.  Credo Action organizes for progressive change through the use of campaigns in which they collect signatures for petitions.  Most petitions are for liberals causes.  They also have a news feed that derives news from mostly left of center sources.

ctvnews.ca.name: CTV News
ctvnews.ca.notes: CTV News Channel is Canada’s 24-hour all-news network. Has a left-Center bias in reporting.

deadline.com.name: Deadline Hollywood
deadline.com.notes: Deadline Hollywood mostly covers entertainment news, however they do occasionally cover politics.  Deadline typically has a left-center political bias in reporting.

democratandchronicle.com.name: Democrat and Chronicle
democratandchronicle.com.notes: The Democrat and Chronicle is a daily newspaper serving the greater Rochester, New York area.  The Democrat and Chronicle is Rochester’s only daily circulated newspaper (Wikipedia). Factual reporting reporting with a left of center editorial bias.

denverpost.com.name: Denver Post
denverpost.com.notes: The Denver Post is a daily newspaper that has been published in Denver, Colorado, United States, since 1892. The Denver Post has won nine Pulitzer Prizes (Wikipedia). Well sourced journalism with a left of center bias in reporting.

freep.com.name: Detroit Free Press
freep.com.notes: The Detroit Free Press is the largest daily newspaper in Detroit, Michigan, USA. The Free Press has received ten Pulitzer Prizes and four Emmy Awards (Wikipedia). High quality journalism with a left of center bias in story selection and editorial content.

digg.com.name: Digg
digg.com.notes: Digg is a news aggregator with a curated front page, aiming to select stories specifically for the Internet audience such as science, trending political issues, and viral Internet issues (Wikipedia). Digg’s curated news articles typically come from left-center biased sources according to our ratings. Their science articles are taken from pro-science sources. Overall, the editorial bias of this website is left-center with factual reporting.

dutchdailynews.com.name: Dutch Daily News
dutchdailynews.com.notes: Dutch Daily News is an English language online news source from the Netherlands.  It is well sourced with a moderate liberal bias.

dw.com.name: DW News
dw.com.notes: Deutsche Welle or DW is Germany’s international broadcaster. The service is aimed towards audiences outside of Germany and is available via television, radio and the Internet. Factual reporting with mild liberal bias.

edmontonjournal.com.name: Edmonton Journal
edmontonjournal.com.notes: The Edmonton Journal is a daily newspaper in Edmonton, Alberta. It is part of the Postmedia Network.

elpais.com.name: El Pais
elpais.com.notes: El País is the highest-circulation daily newspaper in Spain and one of three Madrid dailies considered to be national newspapers of record for Spain (along with El Mundo and ABC). El País, based in Madrid, is owned by the Spanish media conglomerate PRISA.

elpasotimes.com.name: El Paso Times
elpasotimes.com.notes: The El Paso Times is the newspaper for the U.S. city of El Paso, Texas. The paper is currently the only English-language daily in El Paso. Good sourcing with a left-center reporting bias.

emirates247.com.name: Emirates 24/7
emirates247.com.notes: Emirates 24|7 and Emirates 24/7 are a Dubai Media Incorporated news website and television news program, respectively. Has a nationalistic bias, but reports USA and International news with a slight left wing bias.

engadget.com.name: Engadget
engadget.com.notes: Engadget is a multilingual technology blog network with daily coverage of gadgets and consumer electronics. Engadget does not report a lot on politics, but when they do they have a left-center reporting bias.

euractiv.com.name: Euractiv
euractiv.com.notes: EurActiv is an independent European media platform specializing in the online publication of articles dealing with European news and European-centric topics. It is present across 12 EU capitals.  Does not always adhere to scientific consensus and sometimes publishes misleading headlines.

euobserver.com.name: EU Observer
euobserver.com.notes: EUobserver is an independent online newspaper established in Brussels in 2000. It is financially and editorially independent of the EU institutions. EUobserver’s team of journalists file daily news reports from the EU capital and do in-depth investigations on topics of special interest (Wikipedia). Has left-center bias in reporting.

fair.org.name: Fairness & Accuracy in Reporting (FAIR)
fair.org.notes: Fairness and Accuracy In Reporting (FAIR) is a progressive media criticism organization based in New York City. The organization was founded in 1986 by Jeff Cohen and Martin A. Lee. FAIR describes itself as “the national media watch group”. The organization has been described as both progressive and left-wing. (Wikipedia)

fairvote.org.name: FairVote
fairvote.org.notes: FairVote (formerly the Center for Voting and Democracy) is a 501(c)(3) organization that advocates electoral reform in the United States. FairVote advocates the use of Ranked choice voting (RCV), in elections. Under this system, voters rank candidates in order of preference, in contrast to the more widely used plurality voting system (Wikipedia).  FairVote also wants to abolish the electoral college.
