All information is well sourced and uses neutral wording. We rate this source left-center primarily because more liberal organizations endorse this voting system.

feministfrequency.com.name: Feminist Frequency
feministfrequency.com.notes: Feminist Frequency is a not-for-profit site that analyzes the media’s relationship to gender, race, and sexuality, and advocates for “inclusive and representative media.” There is feminist commentary on events and news, which is referenced from credible sources. We couldn’t find any articles written on the hot button issues like abortion, gay rights etc. Rather they seem to be more focused on positive, strong representations of women in media – tv, games, videos, film, etc. (F. Locke Siewert)

fivethirtyeight.com.name: FiveThirtyEight
fivethirtyeight.com.notes: FiveThirtyEight, sometimes referred to as 538, is a website that focuses on opinion poll analysis, politics, economics, and sports blogging. The website, which takes its name from the number of electors in the United States electoral college, was founded on March 7, 2008, as a polling aggregation website with a blog created by analyst Nate Silver (Wikipedia). FiveThirtyEight typically relies on its methodology and not opinion for its reports, however they do publish new stories that have a slight left-center bias in coverage.

france24.com.name: France24
france24.com.notes: France 24 is a 24-hour non-stop international news and current affairs television channel based in Paris, and broadcasts in French, English, and Arabic. The stated mission of the three channels is to “provide a global public service and a common editorial stance (Wikipedia).” France 24 is excellent at delivering breaking news. They have a left of center bias in reporting.

freakonomics.com.name: Freakonomics Radio
freakonomics.com.notes: Freakonomics Radio is an American public radio program which discusses socioeconomic issues for a general audience. The show is a spin-off of the 2005 book Freakonomics. Journalist Stephen Dubner hosts the show, with economist Steven Levitt as a regular guest. The show is also distributed as a podcast, and is among the most popular on iTunes (Wikipedia).

freepress.net.name: Free Press
freepress.net.notes: Free Press is a United States advocacy group. It gives the following mission statement: “We fight to save the free and open Internet, curb runaway media consolidation, protect press freedom, and ensure diverse voices are represented in our media.” The group is a major supporter of net neutrality (Wikipedia). Free Press offers access to government and communications business documents which are unbiased. However, this source also has a blog that has a considerable left wing bias in reporting and use of loaded words. We rate the site factual for information and left wing biased for opinion, which scores as left-center by our methodology.

fresnobee.com.name: Fresno Bee
fresnobee.com.notes: The Fresno Bee is a daily newspaper serving Fresno, California, and surrounding counties in that U.S. state’s San Joaquin Valley. It is owned by The McClatchy Company and ranks fourth in circulation among the company’s newspapers (Wikipedia). Reports factually with sources and has a left of center editorial bias.

fusion.net.name: Fusion
fusion.net.notes: Fusion is a media company that has a TV station and a website. Fusion’s primary focus is on on pop culture and occasionally hard news.  Fusion also publishes satire, which can make it difficult to tell which is real or not. When publishing real news Fusion has a liberal bias, but it is typically sourced.  We could have placed this source in our satire group, but felt since they do publish legitimate content they belong as a real source. Use this site with caution when looking for real news.

greensboro.com.name: Greensboro News and Record
greensboro.com.notes: The News & Record is the largest newspaper serving Guilford County, North Carolina and the surrounding region. It is based in Greensboro, North Carolina and produces local sections for Greensboro and Rockingham County, North Carolina. As of September 30, 2011, it had an average weekday circulation of about 54,789 and an average Sunday circulation of about 81,600. The News & Record is also the third largest paper in North Carolina after the News & Observer and Charlotte Observer (Wikipedia). Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

pri.org/programs/globalpost.name: Global Post
pri.org/programs/globalpost.notes: Global Post is an online US digital journalism company that focuses on international news founded on January 12, 2009 by Philip S. Balboni and Charles M. Sennott.  GlobalPost has syndication agreements with PBS and CBS. As part of the PBS partnership, Global Post correspondents began producing video segments for airing on The PBS NewsHour (Wikipedia). Well sourced and factual.  Some liberal bias in reporting.

globaltimes.cn.name: Global Times (China)
globaltimes.cn.notes: The Global Times is a daily Chinese newspaper that focuses on international issues.  Although they have a very strong pro-government slant they do report USA news with a mild left of center bias.

governing.com.name: Governing Magazine
governing.com.notes: Governing is a national monthly magazine, edited and published since 1987 in Washington, D.C., whose subject area is state and local government in the United States. The magazine covers policy, politics and the management of government enterprises. Its subject areas include such issues as government finance, land use, economic development, the environment, technology and transportation (Wikipedia). Governing has a left of center bias in reporting and is well sourced.

haaretz.com.name: Haaretz
haaretz.com.notes: Haaretz is Israel’s oldest daily newspaper. It was founded in 1918 and is now published in both Hebrew and English in Berliner format. The English edition is published and sold together with the International New York Times. Both Hebrew and English editions can be read on the Internet. In North America, it comes out as a weekly newspaper, combining articles from the Friday edition with a roundup from the rest of the week. It is known for its  left-wing and liberal stances on domestic and foreign issues (Wikipedia).

harpers.org.name: Harpers
harpers.org.notes: Harper’s Magazine (also called Harper’s) is a monthly magazine of literature, politics, culture, finance, and the arts. Launched in June 1850, it is the second-oldest continuously published monthly magazine in the U.S. (Wikipedia). Very high level of journalism.

courant.com.name: The Hartford Courant
courant.com.notes: The Hartford Courant is the largest daily newspaper in the U.S. state of Connecticut, and is often recognized as the oldest continuously published newspaper in the United States. Factual reporting, left-center editorial stance.

heavy.com.name: Heavy
heavy.com.notes: Heavy.com is a news and information website based in New York City.  Heavy.com is self-described as “a real-time news and information portal”, and, on its site, claims to reach “35 million unique visitors per month (Wikipedia).” Has a left of center bias in reporting and story selection.  Sometimes jumps the gun on breaking news and has to retract.

helsinkitimes.fi.name: Helsinki Times
helsinkitimes.fi.notes: Helsinki Times is the first English language daily online newspaper in Finland providing news about Finland and the world for English-speaking readers resident in the country (Wikipedia).

historynewsnetwork.org.name: History News Network
historynewsnetwork.org.notes: The History News Network is a non-profit corporation registered in Washington State. The editor and founder of HNN is Rick Shenkman; its Advisory Board includes other academic scholars such as historians Gil Troy and Joyce Appleby, and Leonard Steinhorn. The mission of HNN is to help readers put the news into historical perspective (Wikipedia). Reports with minimal loaded words and sources well. Has a left-center political bias in reporting.

hollywoodreporter.com.name: Hollywood Reporter
hollywoodreporter.com.notes: Primarily an entertainment media source, but does report on politics with a left-center bias.

staradvertiser.com.name: Honolulu Star-Advertiser
staradvertiser.com.notes: The Honolulu Star-Advertiser is the largest daily newspaper in Hawaii, formed in 2010 with the merger of The Honolulu Advertiser and the Honolulu Star-Bulletin. Factual reporting with a left of center editorial bias.

chron.com.name: Houston Chronicle
chron.com.notes: The Houston Chronicle is the largest daily newspaper in Houston, Texas, United States. Factual reporting with left-center editorial bias.

hurriyetdailynews.com.name: Hurriyet Daily News
hurriyetdailynews.com.notes: The Hürriyet Daily News, formerly Hürriyet Daily News and Economic Review and Turkish Daily News, is the oldest current English-language daily in Turkey, founded in 1961. Hürriyet Daily News takes a secular and liberal or center-left position on most political issues, in contrast to its two main competitors, Today’s Zaman and the Daily Sabah, which is closely aligned with the Justice and Development Party of Recep Tayyip Erdoğan (Wikipedia).

icenews.is.name: Ice News
icenews.is.notes: IceNews is an Icelandic based news outlet. It specializes in providing English-language news on the Nordic countries of Denmark, the Faroe Islands, Finland, Greenland, Iceland, Norway, Sweden and elsewhere in northern Europe, primarily the United Kingdom. It publishes articles on current affairs, politics, entertainment, culture, travel and forthcoming events (Wikipedia).

indymedia.org.name: Independent Media Center
indymedia.org.notes: The Independent Media Center (also known as Indymedia or IMC) is a global open publishing network of journalist collectives that report on political and social issues. It is closely associated with the global justice movement, which criticizes neo-liberalism and its associated institutions. Indymedia uses democratic media process that allows anybody to contribute (Wikipedia). Due to publishing being open some stories may not be sourced properly.

indystar.com.name: Indianapolis Star
indystar.com.notes: The Indianapolis Star is a morning daily newspaper that began publishing on June 6, 1903. It has won the Pulitzer Prize for Investigative Reporting twice, in 1975 and 1991. It is currently owned by the Gannett Company. Has left-center bias in editorial stance and is well sourced.

inquisitr.com.name: Inquisitr
inquisitr.com.notes: Inquisitr is an aggregate news and media website owned by Daniel Treisman, an Israeli businessman who relaunched the website in 2011. The site views itself as a ‘multi-news aggregator’ that publishes both trending news and original articles. The news website caters to a global audience.  Has a left-center bias on their original content.

insidehighered.com.name: Inside Higher Ed
insidehighered.com.notes: Inside Higher Ed is a daily online publication focused on college and university topics, based in Washington, D.C., United States. While most of the reporting is about news within the field of higher education, they do occasionally cover politics with a left of center bias in reporting and affiliation.

icrw.org.name: International Center for Research on Women
icrw.org.notes: The International Center for Research on Women (ICRW) is a non-profit organization headquartered in Washington, D.C., United States, with a regional office in New Delhi, India. ICRW has project offices in Mumbai and Hyderabad India, and is establishing a formal presence in East Africa. ICRW works to promote gender equitable development within the field of international development.

crisisgroup.org.name: International Crisis Group
crisisgroup.org.notes: The International Crisis Group (Crisis Group) is a transnational non-profit, non-governmental organization founded in 1995 that carries out field research on violent conflict and advances policies to prevent, mitigate or resolve conflict. It advocates policies directly with governments, multilateral organisations and other political actors as well as the media. (Wikipedia)

ipolitics.ca.name: iPolitics
ipolitics.ca.notes: iPolitics covers Canadian politics and news.  They have a very mild left of center bias and are factual in reporting from credible sources.

jointcenter.org.name: Joint Center for Political and Economic Studies
jointcenter.org.notes: A U.S. national, nonprofit institution that conducts research on public policy issues of special concern to African Americans.

helvidius.org.name: Journal of Politics and Society
helvidius.org.notes: The Journal of Politics & Society is an academic journal of the social sciences published twice a year by the Helvidius Group, a nonprofit student organization at Columbia University (Wikipedia).

kansascity.com.name: Kansas City Star
kansascity.com.notes: The Kansas City Star is a newspaper based in Kansas City, Missouri, in the United States. Published since 1880, the paper is the recipient of eight Pulitzer Prizes. (Wikipedia)

knightfoundation.org.name: Knight Foundation
knightfoundation.org.notes: The John S. and James L. Knight Foundation is an American private, non-profit foundation dedicated to supporting “transformational ideas that promote quality journalism, advance media innovation, engage communities and foster the arts.”

latimes.com.name: LA Times (Los Angeles Times)
latimes.com.notes: The Los Angeles Times, commonly referred to as the Times or LA Times, is a paid daily newspaper published in Los Angeles, California, since 1881. It was the largest metropolitan newspaper in circulation in the United States in 2008 and the fourth most widely distributed newspaper in the country (Wikipedia). Well sourced with a left-center editorial bias.

lawnewz.com.name: Law Newz
lawnewz.com.notes: Law Newz is founded and run by Dan Abrams, who is currently the Chief Legal Anchor for ABC News, and host of both 60 Days In and Live PD on the A&E network. Has a slight left bias in reporting, but is well source.

lethbridgeherald.com.name: Lethbridge Herald
lethbridgeherald.com.notes: The Lethbridge Herald is the leading daily newspaper in greater Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada. Well sourced reporting with a left-center editorial position.

metro.co.uk.name: Metro UK
metro.co.uk.notes: Metro is a free newspaper published in tabloid format in the United Kingdom by DMG Media (part of Daily Mail and General Trust). The Metro primarily covers entertainment and local news, but also occasionally politics with a left-center bias in wording and story selection.

mexiconewsdaily.com.name: Mexico Daily News
mexiconewsdaily.com.notes: Curates news stories from Mexico in English.  Bias is determined by the sources they curate.

miamiherald.com.name: Miami Herald
miamiherald.com.notes: The Miami Herald is a daily newspaper owned by the McClatchy Company and headquartered in Doral, Florida, a city in western Miami-Dade County several miles west of Miami.  Founded in 1903, it is the second largest newspaper in South Florida, serving Miami-Dade, Broward County, and Monroe County. It also circulates throughout Latin America and the Caribbean.

miaminewtimes.com.name: Miami New Times
miaminewtimes.com.notes: The Miami New Times is a free weekly newspaper published in Miami and distributed every Thursday. Has a left-center bias in reporting.  Well sourced.

mic.com.name: Mic
mic.com.notes: Mic (formerly PolicyMic) is a media company that targets millennials. The company reaches 19 million unique monthly visitors and has a higher composition of 18- to 34-year-old readers than any other millennial-focused news site, including BuzzFeed and Vice. (Wikipedia) Mic has a left of center bias in reporting, but they are factual and source to other credible sources.

jsonline.com.name: Milwaukee Journal-Sentinel
jsonline.com.notes: The Milwaukee Journal Sentinel is a daily morning broadsheet printed in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. It is the primary newspaper in Milwaukee, the largest newspaper in Wisconsin and is distributed widely throughout the state. It is owned by the Gannett Company.  Gets it’s news from the USA Network which is centrist, but has a left-center editorial bias.

startribune.com.name: Minneapolis Star Tribune
startribune.com.notes: The Star Tribune is the largest newspaper in the U.S. state of Minnesota. Is well sourced with a left-center editorial bias.

mintpressnews.com.name: Mint Press News
mintpressnews.com.notes: MintPress News is an independent Minnesota-based news website launched in 2012. It covers political, economic, foreign affairs and environmental issues. Mint Press has a left wing bias in reporting, but is well source and evidence based in reporting.

monthlyreview.org.name: Monthly Review
monthlyreview.org.notes: The Monthly Review, established in 1949, is an independent socialist magazine published monthly in New York City. As of 2015 the publication remains the longest continuously published socialist magazine in the United States. The journal has an impact factor of 0.460.  Has an obvious left wing political bias, but as an academic journal is evidence based.

montrealgazette.com.name: Montreal Gazette
montrealgazette.com.notes: A daily English newspaper from Montreal, Canada.  Canada’s oldest newspaper. Has a left-center editorial bias.

morningconsult.com.name: Morning Consult
morningconsult.com.notes: Morning Consult is a nonpartisan digital media and survey research company established in 2013.  The company provides news coverage, survey research, and data technology tools on issues in politics, policy and business.  Morning Consult is the official polling partner of POLITICO, Vox, Fortune, and Bloomberg News (Wikipedia). Very evidence based reporting, with just slight left of center bias in story selection.

themoscowtimes.com.name: Moscow Times
themoscowtimes.com.notes: The Moscow Times (MT) is an English-language weekly newspaper published in Moscow, with a circulation of 35,000 copies. It’s distributed for free at places frequented by English-speaking expatriates such as hotels, cafés, embassies, and airlines. It is also available by subscription, but it is not available at newsstands. The newspaper is very popular among foreign citizens residing in Moscow and English-speaking Russians (Wikipedia). The Moscow Times has a pro-western bias in reporting.

resourcegovernance.org.name: Natural Resource Governance Institute
resourcegovernance.org.notes: Monitors economic reconstruction in the country, focusing on the oil industry, to ensure it is managed responsibly.

nbcnews.com.name: NBC News
nbcnews.com.notes: NBC News is considered a mainstream media source. NBC News is a division of the American broadcast network NBC. The division operates under NBCUniversal News Group, a subsidiary of NBC Universal, all owned by Comcast (Wikipedia). Has a left-center bias in reporting and is well sourced.

ncpolicywatch.com.name: NC Policy Watch
ncpolicywatch.com.notes: NC Policy Watch’ is a North Carolina public-policy think tank co-founded by Chris Fitzsimon and the A.J. Fletcher Foundation. The organization works in numerous public policy fields including issues of poverty, health care, mental health issues, transportation, and tax reform (Wikipedia). NC Policy Watch has moderate left-center bias in reporting as they support mostly progressive causes. All information is well sourced and factual.

news.com.au.name: News.com.au
news.com.au.notes: News.com.au is an Australian news and entertainment website owned by News Corp Australia. It specializes in breaking national and international news as well as entertainment, sport, lifestyle, travel, technology and finance (Wikipedia). News.com.au has a left-center bias though story selection and political editorial bias. They are well sourced and factual.

newsday.com.name: Newsday
newsday.com.notes: Newsday is an American daily newspaper that primarily serves Nassau and Suffolk counties and the New York City borough of Queens on Long Island, although it is sold throughout the New York metropolitan area. Newsday has a left wing editorial bias, but reports with credible sourcing.

newsone.com.name: NewsOne
newsone.com.notes: NewsOne is a news and opinion website that focuses on news about Blacks in America. NewsOne has a moderate left wing bias in wording and story choices, but balance this with well sourced factual reporting.

newsweek.com.name: Newsweek
newsweek.com.notes: Newsweek is an American weekly news magazine founded in 1933.  Over the last few years it’s content has shifted more to the left.  If this trend continues this source may move to Left bias.

newsy.com.name: Newsy
newsy.com.notes: Newsy is a video news network that produces short-form video news pieces that provide breaking news and updates across U.S. and world news, policy and politics, science and health, entertainment, technology, business and sports (Wikipedia).

newmatilda.com.name: New Matilda
newmatilda.com.notes: Newmatilda.com, commonly known as New Matilda, is a left-wing independent Australian website of news, analysis and satire.

newmoderate.com.name: New Moderate
newmoderate.com.notes: Although this source claims to be centrist, most of the wording and reporting has a slight left of center of bias.

nydailynews.com.name: New York Daily News
nydailynews.com.notes: The New York Daily News is an American newspaper based in New York City. It is the fourth-most widely circulated daily newspaper in the United States. It was founded in 1919, and was the first U.S. daily printed in tabloid format. Publishes news with sensational headlines that do not always match the story.

newsandgutsmedia.com.name: News and Guts
newsandgutsmedia.com.notes: News and Guts is an independent media company founded by long time news journalist Dan Rather. The website features writings by Dan Rather that is well sourced and well written. Has a left-center political bias in reporting only.

npr.org.name: NPR (National Public Radio)
npr.org.notes: National Public Radio usually shortened to NPR, is an American privately and publicly funded non-profit membership media organization that serves as a national syndicator to a network of 900 public radio stations in the United States of America.  Very centrist in reporting. Very factual.  Has a liberal editorial bias.

nytimes.com.name: New York Times
nytimes.com.notes: The New York Times (sometimes abbreviated to NYT) is an American daily newspaper, founded and continuously published in New York City since September 18, 1851, by The New York Times Company. The New York Times has won 117 Pulitzer Prizes, more than any other news organization (Wikipedia). NYT is well sourced an factual in reporting.  The paper has a pretty strong left wing editorial bias.

oilandwaterdontmix.org.name: Oil and Water Don’t Mix
oilandwaterdontmix.org.notes: Oil and Water Don’t Mix is a number of organizations and citizens across Michigan who are working to keep oil out of the Great Lakes. Reports factually on the situation of pipelines that effect the lake. Has a left-center environmental bias in reporting.

opposingviews.com.name: Opposing Views
opposingviews.com.notes: Opposing Views (also known as OV) is an American digital news website headquartered in Los Angeles.  The site presents original and aggregated news articles from across the political spectrum.  Though our article sampling there were more articles that leaned left.

ozy.com.name: Ozy Media
ozy.com.notes: OZY Media is an international online magazine that focuses on news, arts, culture, politics, business and sports. OZY was launched in September 2013 by former MSNBC news anchor, journalist, and businessman Carlos Watson (Wikipedia). Ozy produces well sourced content that is factually based with a left-center bias in report choices and wording.

panampost.com.name: PanAm Post
panampost.com.notes: The PanAm Post is an American news and analysis website that specializes in international subjects as well as topics in the Americas. The website focuses on multilingual and international content in order to follow “the tradition of Pan-Americanism”. It was founded in 2013 and its headquarters is in Miami, Florida.

pbs.org.name: PBS News Hour
pbs.org.notes: The PBS NewsHour is an American daily evening television news program that is broadcast on the Public Broadcasting Service (PBS), airing seven nights a week on more than 300 of the public broadcaster’s member stations. As the nation’s first hour-long nightly news broadcast, the program is known for its in-depth coverage of issues and current events (Wikipedia). PBS produces high quality journalism that is sourced and factual. They have a left-center bias in reporting.

philly.com.name: Philadelphia Inquirer
philly.com.notes: The Philadelphia Inquirer is a morning daily newspaper that serves the Philadelphia, metropolitan area of the United States. Is factual in reporting, with a left-center editorial bias.

inquirer.net.name: Philippine Daily Inquirer
inquirer.net.notes: The Philippine Daily Inquirer, popularly known as the Inquirer, is the most widely read broadsheet newspaper in the Philippines,with a daily circulation of 260,000 copies (Wikipedia).

post-gazette.com.name: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
post-gazette.com.notes: Daily newspaper from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. The Pittsburgh Post-Gazette is factual in reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

politicalcritique.org.name: Political Critique
politicalcritique.org.notes: Krytyka Polityczna (Political Critique) is the largest Central and Eastern European liberal network of institutions and activists. Has a left of center political bias, but reports with sourcing and evidence.

politico.com.name: Politico
politico.com.notes: Politico is an American political-journalism organization based in Arlington County, Virginia, that covers politics and policy in the United States and internationally. It distributes content via television, the Internet, The Politico newspaper, radio, and podcasts. Its coverage in Washington, D.C., includes the U.S. Congress, lobbying, media and the presidency. Has a left-center bias in reporting.

pressherald.com.name: Portland Press-Herald
pressherald.com.notes: The Portland Press Herald (and Maine Sunday Telegram; collectively known as The Portland Newspapers) publish daily newspapers in the city of Portland, Maine, in the United States (Wikipedia). Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

presstv.com.name: Press TV
presstv.com.notes: Press TV is a 24-hour English language news and documentary network, affiliated with Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting (IRIB). IRIB is state-owned but independent of the Iranian government in its management, and is the only legal TV and radio broadcaster inside Iran.  Has a strong Iranian nationalism in reporting.  However, when reporting USA new it has a Left-Center political bias.

propublica.org.name: Propublica
propublica.org.notes: ProPublica is a non-profit corporation based in New York City. It describes itself as an independent non-profit newsroom that produces investigative journalism in the public interest. In 2010 it became the first online news source to win a Pulitzer Prize (Wikipedia). Evidence based reporting with a left-center political bias.

prospectmagazine.co.uk.name: Prospect Magazine
prospectmagazine.co.uk.notes: Prospect is a monthly British general interest magazine, specializing in politics, economics and current affairs. It features a mixture of lengthy analytic articles, first-person reportage, one-page columns, and shorter, quirky items (Wikipedia). Well sourced journalism with a left-center bias in reporting.

providencejournal.com.name: The Providence Journal
providencejournal.com.notes: Daily newspaper from Providence, Rhode Island. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

pri.org.name: Public Radio International (PRI)
pri.org.notes: Public Radio International (PRI) is a Minneapolis-based American public radio organization, with locations in Boston, New York, London and Beijing. PRI is a media content creator and also distributes programs from many sources, competing with National Public Radio, American Public Media and the Public Radio Exchange to provide programming to public radio stations (Wikipedia).

putintrump.org.name: PutinTrump.org
putintrump.org.notes: PutinTrump.org aggregates news about USA-Russia relations as it relates to Trump and Putin. They aggregate news from a wide variety of sources with most from our Left-Center bias category and some from Least Biased. Editorially there is a clear left bias against Trump.

qz.com.name: Quartz
qz.com.notes: Quartz (qz.com) is a digital global business news publication. It is owned by Atlantic Media Co., the publisher of The Atlantic, National Journal, and Government Executive.  Quartz targets high-earning readers who traditionally read other left-leaning publications (Wikipedia).

rfa.org.name: Radio Free Asia
rfa.org.notes: Radio Free Asia (RFA) is a private, nonprofit international broadcasting agency of the United States government that broadcasts and publishes online news, information, and commentary to listeners in East Asia while “advancing the goals of U.S. foreign policy.” RFA is funded by the Broadcasting Board of Governors (BBG), an independent agency of the United States government responsible for all non-military, international broadcasting sponsored by the U.S government (such as Radio Free Europe), which appoints the board of RFA. RFA distributes content in nine Asian languages for audiences in six countries (Wikipedia).

newsobserver.com.name: Raleigh News and Observer
newsobserver.com.notes: The News & Observer is a regional daily newspaper that serves the greater Triangle area based In Raleigh. The paper is the second largest in the state after The Charlotte Observer. The paper has also been awarded three Pulitzer Prizes (Wikipedia). Has a left of center editorial bias.

rationalwiki.org.name: RationalWiki
rationalwiki.org.notes: The purpose of RationalWiki is: Analyzing and refuting pseudoscience and the anti-science movement, documenting the full range of crank ideas, explorations of authoritarianism and fundamentalism, analysis and criticism of how these subjects are handled in the media.  RationalWiki does have a left of center bias in what they choose to list.

therealnews.com.name: Real News Network
therealnews.com.notes: The Real News (TRNN) is a nonprofit, viewer-supported daily video-news and documentary service. TRNN launched in 2007 by Paul Jay, who serves as the network’s CEO and senior editor. TRNN describes itself as a news source “focused on providing independent and uncompromising journalism.” (Wikipedia) The Real News has a moderate left wing bias that is reflected in it’s positions on economics.  It generally gives perspective from both sides, but favors more left-wing economics through whom it interviews.

revealnews.org.name: Reveal – Center for Investigative Reporting
revealnews.org.notes: The Center for Investigative Reporting (CIR) is a nonprofit news organization based in Emeryville, California, and has conducted investigative journalism since 1977. It is known for producing stories that reveal scandals or corruption in government agencies and corporations..  Has won numerous high standard journalism awards.

rollingstone.com.name: Rolling Stone
rollingstone.com.notes: Rolling Stone is an American biweekly magazine that focuses on popular culture. It was founded in San Francisco in 1967 by Jann Wenner, who is still the magazine’s publisher.  Although Rolling Stone is primarily known as a Music Magazine, it has a long history of cover politics.  Its reporting can be very in-depth and well researched.  Has a left of center bias on most issues.

rooseveltinstitute.org.name: Roosevelt Institute
rooseveltinstitute.org.notes: The Roosevelt Institute is a liberal American think tank. According to the organization, it exists “to carry forward the legacy and values of Franklin and Eleanor Roosevelt by developing progressive ideas and bold leadership in the service of restoring America’s promise of opportunity for all.” It is headquartered in New York, New York (Wikipedia). Has a left center wing political bias, but is factually sourced.

rudaw.net.name: Rudaw
rudaw.net.notes: Rudaw is a Kurdish media network funded and supported by Rudaw Company. The network aims to impart news and information about Kurdistan and the Middle East. Rudaw is based in Erbil, the capital city of the Kurdistan Region of Iraq. The company has correspondents in various parts of the Middle East, Europe and the U.S. Rudaw publishes in the Kurdish dialects Sorani and Kurmanji as well as in English (Wikipedia).

sacbee.com.name: Sacramento Bee
sacbee.com.notes: The Sacramento Bee is a daily newspaper published in Sacramento, California, in the United States. Since its founding in 1857, The Bee has become the largest newspaper in Sacramento, the fifth largest newspaper in California, and the 27th largest paper in the U.S. (Wikipedia)

sltrib.com.name: Salt Lake Tribune
sltrib.com.notes: Daily newspaper from Salt Lake City, Utah. Factual in reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

mysanantonio.com.name: San Antonio Express-News
mysanantonio.com.notes: Daily newspaper from San Antonio, Texas. Has a left-center editorial bias.

sfchronicle.com.name: San Francisco Chronicle
sfchronicle.com.notes: California newspaper from San Francisco. Has a moderate left wing editorial bias with factual, sourced reporting.

mercurynews.com.name: San Jose Mercury News
mercurynews.com.notes: California newspaper from San Jose. The newspaper has earned several awards, including two Pulitzer Prizes. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial stance.

scoopwhoop.com.name: ScoopWhoop
scoopwhoop.com.notes: ScoopWhoop is an internet media and news company from India. The company creates and curates India specific stories (Wikipedia). Scoopwhoop features many stories on social issues with little focus on USA news, unless it’s viral, similar to Buzzfeed.  The articles about the USA tend to link to credible sources such as Reuters, however the stories are often misleading due to the use of emotional words or outright false claims.  For example, in an article titled “Russia Vows ‘Adequate Response’ After US Expels 35 Russian Diplomats For ‘Spying’,” Scoopwhoop claims in a quote, that according to the BBC, Russia will “cause the US government ‘significant destruction’“. This simply is not true as Putin never said this and the BBC never reported it.  Overall, this source tends to have a left-center reporting bias and is not always well sourced and factual (M. Allen).

seattlepi.com.name: Seattle Post-Intelligencer
seattlepi.com.notes: The Seattle Post-Intelligencer is an online newspaper and former print newspaper covering Seattle, Washington, United States, and the surrounding metropolitan area. Has a left-center editorial bias.

seattletimes.com.name: Seattle Times
seattletimes.com.notes: Newspaper from Seattle, Washington. The Seattle Times reporting has received 10 Pulitzer Prizes. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

secondnexus.com.name: Second Nexus
secondnexus.com.notes: Second Nexus is website that reports a variety of news.  Has a left of center political bias in reporting.

news.sky.com.name: Sky News
news.sky.com.notes: Sky News is a 24-hour international multimedia news operation based in Britain. Originally a 24-hour television news channel in the UK, Sky News now provides rolling news on television, online, and on a range of mobile devices. Sky News emphasizes breaking news (Wikipedia).

splcenter.org.name: Southern Poverty Law Center
splcenter.org.notes: The Southern Poverty Law Center is an American nonprofit legal advocacy organization specializing in civil rights and public interest litigation. It is noted for its legal victories against white supremacist groups and its legal representation for victims of hate groups.  The SPLC also classifies and lists hate groups—organizations that in its opinion “attack or malign an entire class of people, typically for their immutable characteristics (Wikipedia).

spiegel.de.name: Spiegel Online
spiegel.de.notes: Spiegel Online (SPON) is one of the most widely read German-language news Websites. It was founded in 1994 as the Web offspring of the German news magazine, Der Spiegel, with a staff of journalists independent from the magazine. Today, Spiegel Online is the most frequently quoted online media product in Germany. Spiegel Online International, an English section featuring articles translated into English, was launched in autumn 2004 (Wikipedia). Spiegel Online has a left-center political bias through wording and story choices. They source to credible information and are factual in reporting.

nj.com.name: Star-Ledger
nj.com.notes: New Jersey’s largest newspaper. The Star Ledger reports with sources and is factual.  They have a left of center editorial bias.

stltoday.com.name: St. Louis Post-Dispatch
stltoday.com.notes: Daily newspaper from St. Louis, Missouri. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

stopfake.org.name: StopFake
stopfake.org.notes: www.stopfake.org is a credible news source, but you will find a very pro Ukraine stand point to combat the state controlled and often very pro Russian news most people in that area get. From speaking with sources from Ukraine and people familiar with the conflicts, the news in Ukraine and around Crimea is riddled with false and misleading information often from Russian sources.  There’s little to be trusted. As far as the site goes: Titles like: Six Outrageous Lies Russian Disinformation Peddled about Europe in 2016  Uses a very modern click bait method to gain attention. However, inside it shows the various .ru (Russian) news reports that show disinformation that is being spread throughout Europe about various events. Some to focus on are the rise of immigrants into Europe and over stating the crimes and destruction they pose. Russian media claims that Poland is building a wall to keep Ukraine people out.  But references an interview where that is never mentioned.

thesunmagazine.org.name: The Sun Magazine
thesunmagazine.org.notes: The Sun is a monthly American magazine publishing essays, interviews, short stories, poems, and photography. The overall goal for the publication, as stated by editor and co-founder, Sy Safransky, is to create a feeling of connection between contributors and readers (Wikipedia). When covering political issues they have a left wing bias, but always source well.

tampabay.com.name: Tampa Bay Times
tampabay.com.notes: The Tampa Bay Times is an American newspaper published in St. Petersburg, Florida. It has won twelve Pulitzer Prizes. It is published by the Times Publishing Company, which is owned by The Poynter Institute for Media Studies, a nonprofit journalism.  The Tampa Bay Times also operates Politifact, one of the most respected political fact checking sites.  Considered one of the best papers in the country with a left of center editorial bias.

theage.com.au.name: The Age (Australia)
theage.com.au.notes: The Age is a daily newspaper which has been published in Melbourne, Australia, since 1854. Owned and published by Fairfax Media.  Is the most popular paper in Australia.

tcf.org.name: The Century Foundation
tcf.org.notes: A progressive, nonpartisan think tank that seeks to foster opportunity, reduce inequality, and promote security at home and abroad (Wikipedia). The Century Foundation has a moderate left bias in report choices and uses minimal loaded words.  They are well sourced and generally factual.

thechristianleft.org.name: The Christian Left
thechristianleft.org.notes: The Christian Left is a news and information blog with a progressive political view. The Christian Left advocates for liberal policies such as pro-choice with abortion and pro-LGBT rights. Typically, the information is well source and written with minimal loaded words, therefore the bias of this source comes from political affiliation and information content.

courier-journal.com.name: The Courier-Journal
courier-journal.com.notes: Daily newspaper from Kentucky. Factual reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

dailyclimate.org.name: The Daily Climate
dailyclimate.org.notes: The Daily Climate is an independent media organization working to increase public understanding of climate change, including its scope and scale, potential solutions and the political processes that impede or advance them. The Daily Climate is funded by foundations and readers and does not accept money from interest groups. The Daily Climate is pro-science, but it does have a left wing political bias.

economictimes.indiatimes.com.name: The Economic Times
economictimes.indiatimes.com.notes: The Economic Times is an English-language, Indian daily newspaper published by the Bennett, Coleman & Co. Ltd.. First published in 1961, it is the world’s second-most widely read English-language business newspaper, after the Wall Street Journal, with a readership of over 800,000 (Wikipedia). Just a very slight left-center political bias.

thefifthcolumnnews.com.name: The Fifth Column
thefifthcolumnnews.com.notes: The Fifth Column is a news and opinion website that features very well written journalism that is sourced.  Occasionally The Fifth Column publishes stories that are bordering on conspiracy.  They also occasionally publish information that goes against the consensus of science, but on a whole the majority of their reporting is evidence based. Good source if used with caution.

forward.com.name: The Forward
forward.com.notes: The Forward, also called The Jewish Daily Forward, is an American newspaper published in New York City for a Jewish-American audience. The organization publishes two newspapers, weekly in English (The Forward) and biweekly in Yiddish (Forverts) and websites updated daily in both languages (Wikipedia). Reports factually and is well sourced. Has a pretty strong left-center editorial bias.

theglobeandmail.com.name: The Globe and Mail
theglobeandmail.com.notes: The Globe and Mail is a nationally distributed Canadian newspaper owned by The Woodbridge Company, based in Toronto and printed in six cities across the country. With a weekly readership of 2,018,923 in 2015 (Wikipedia). Very centrist in reporting with an emphasis on economic liberalism.  Factual reporting.

theguardian.com.name: The Guardian
theguardian.com.notes: The Guardian is a daily newspaper from the United Kingdom.  The Guardian freely admits they are a center-left newspaper. Reports factually, but with a left-center bias in reporting and sometimes wording.

thehill.com.name: The Hill
thehill.com.notes: The Hill is an American political journalism newspaper and website published in Washington, D.C. since 1994.[3][4][5] It is published by Capitol Hill Publishing, which is owned by News Communications, Inc. Focusing on politics, policy, business and international relations, The Hill coverage includes the U.S. Congress, the presidency, and election campaigns (Wikipedia). The Hill covers both sides on the political spectrum and generally source information, however they sometimes rush stories and have to change them after the fact.  Has a left-center reporting bias.

newsite.thehindu.com.name: The Hindu
newsite.thehindu.com.notes: The Hindu is an English-language Indian daily newspaper. The Hindu has been accused of left-wing bias with its articles and editorials, but covers the USA with a more centrist approach.

independent.co.uk.name: The Independent
independent.co.uk.notes: The Independent is a British online newspaper. Established in 1986 as an independent national morning newspaper published in London, it was controlled by Tony O’Reilly’s Independent News & Media from 1997 until it was sold to Russian oligarch Alexander Lebedev in 2010. Since March 2016, it is no longer printed, but is available for readers online (Wikipedia).  The Independent tends to take a classical liberal, pro-market stance on economic issues. Has a left of center editorial stance.

theintercept.com.name: The Intercept
theintercept.com.notes: The Intercept is an online publication launched in February 2014 by First Look Media, the news organization created and funded by eBay founder Pierre Omidyar. The editors are Betsy Reed, Glenn Greenwald and Jeremy Scahill (Wikipedia). The Intercept produces well sourced quality journalism.  They have a left-center bias in reporting and tend to use loaded, sensational words.

irishtimes.com.name: The Irish Times
irishtimes.com.notes: The Irish Times is an Irish daily broadsheet newspaper launched on 29 March 1859. Factual reporting with a promotion of social liberalism (Wikipedia).

irrawaddy.com.name: The Irrawaddy
irrawaddy.com.notes: The Irrawaddy is a website by the Irrawaddy Publishing Group (IPG), founded in 1990 by Burmese exiles living in Thailand. From its inception, The Irrawaddy has taken an independent stance on Burmese politics. The Irrawaddy is published in both English and Burmese, with a primary focus on Burma and Southeast Asia. It is regarded as one of the foremost journalistic publications dealing with political, social, economic and cultural developments in Burma. In addition to news, it features in-depth political analysis and interviews with a wide range of Burma experts, business leaders, democracy activists and other influential figures (Wikipedia). When covering USA and western news the Irrawaddy has a left-center political bias through wording and story coverage.

jpost.com/Jerusalem-Report.name: The Jerusalem Report
jpost.com/Jerusalem-Report.notes: The Jerusalem Report is a fortnightly print and online news magazine that covers political and social issues in Israel, the Middle East and the Jewish world (Wikipedia). Has a Pro-Israel stance and a left of center editorial bias.

lohud.com.name: The Journal News
lohud.com.notes: The Journal News is a newspaper in New York serving the New York counties of Westchester, Rockland, and Putnam, a region known as the Lower Hudson Valley. It is owned by the Gannett Company, Inc. (Wikipedia). Left of center editorial bias.

thelocal.no.name: The Local (Norway)
thelocal.no.notes: A digital only news source from Norway. Has a left-center bias in reporting choices.

themonthly.com.au.name: The Monthly (Australia)
themonthly.com.au.notes: The Monthly is an Australian national magazine of politics, society and the arts, which is published eleven times per year on a monthly basis except the December/January issue.  The Monthly features excellent journalism with a left-center bias in wording and stories.

nationinstitute.org.name: The Nation Institute
nationinstitute.org.notes: The Nation Institute is a nonprofit media organization associated with The Nation magazine. It sponsors fellows, host forums, publishes, and is involved in awards for journalism (Wikipedia).

thenewstribune.com.name: The News Tribune
thenewstribune.com.notes: The News Tribune is a daily newspaper in Tacoma, Washington, in the United States.  The News Tribune has mild use of loaded words with a left wing bias, is well sourced and covers both sides of a story.

cleveland.com.name: The Plain Dealer
cleveland.com.notes: Newspaper from Cleveland, Ohio. The Plain Dealer is factual in reporting with a left-center editorial bias.

theguardian.com.name: The Observer (UK)
theguardian.com.notes: The Observer is a British newspaper, published on Sundays. In the same place on the political spectrum as its sister papers The Guardian and The Guardian Weekly, whose parent company Guardian Media Group Limited acquired it in 1993, it claims to take a social liberal or social democratic line on most issues. First published in 1791, it is the world’s oldest Sunday newspaper (Wikipedia).

theoslotimes.com.name: The Oslo Times
theoslotimes.com.notes: Digital newspaper from Oslo, Norway. Has a left of center bias in reporting.

northjersey.com.name: The Record (New Jersey)
northjersey.com.notes: The Record is a Northern New Jersey daily newspaper with factual reporting and a left-center political bias.

thestranger.com.name: The Stranger
thestranger.com.notes: The Stranger is an alternative weekly newspaper in Seattle, Washington, USA. Has a pretty strong left wing bias in reporting, but typically sources to credible information.

smh.com.au.name: The Sydney Morning Herald
smh.com.au.notes: The Sydney Morning Herald (SMH) is a daily compact newspaper published by Fairfax Media in Sydney, Australia. Has a left-center bias in reporting an affiliation.

thetyee.ca.name: The Tyee
thetyee.ca.notes: The Tyee is a left-of-center independent online Canadian news magazine that primarily covers British Columbia (Wikipedia). Has a liberal editorial bias, but reports factually and with moderate loaded words.

theverge.com.name: The Verge
theverge.com.notes: The Verge is an American technology news and media network operated by Vox Media. It has offices in Manhattan, New York City. The network publishes news items, long-form feature stories, product reviews, podcasts, and an entertainment show. (Wikipedia)  Covers politics with a left-center bias.

theweek.com.name: The Week
theweek.com.notes: The Week is a weekly British news magazine which also publishes a US edition, and between 2008 and 2012 additionally published an Australian edition (Wikipedia). Has a left-center bias in word choices and reporting.

thisisthezerohour.com.name: The Zero Hour
thisisthezerohour.com.notes: The Zero Hour is a weekly three-hour program which combines news and analysis with in-depth interviews on topics that include politics, pop culture, futurism, high-tech, and music.  The Zero Hour provides factual news framed with a left-center bias.

news.trust.org.name: Thomson Reuters Foundation
news.trust.org.notes: Thomson Reuters Foundation is the charitable arm of Thomson Reuters, the global news and information provider.  The Foundation works to expose corruption worldwide and is active in the global fight against human trafficking (Wikipedia). Not to be confused with Reuters news agency.

time.com.name: Time Magazine
time.com.notes: Time is an American weekly news magazine published in New York City. It was founded in 1923.  Time has the world’s largest circulation for a weekly news magazine. Time Magazine is factual in reporting and well sourced.  Has a left-center bias in story selection.

timescolonist.com.name: Times-Colonist
timescolonist.com.notes: The Times Colonist is an English-language daily newspaper in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. The Times Colonist has a left-center bias in editorial bias.

timesofisrael.com.name: Times of Israel
timesofisrael.com.notes: The Times of Israel is an online newspaper published in English, Arabic, French, Chinese, and Persian which covers “developments in Israel, the Middle East and around the Jewish world”, according to the site’s nameplate.  In addition to publishing news reports and analysis, The Times of Israel hosts a multi-author blog platform. Its headquarters are in Jerusalem.  (Wikipedia) The Times of Israel has a left of center bias on reporting by USA standards.

nola.com.name: The Times-Picayune
nola.com.notes: The Times-Picayune is an American newspaper published in New Orleans, Louisiana, since January 25, 1837. Factual reporting a left-center editorial bias.

tomdispatch.com.name: TomDispatch.com
tomdispatch.com.notes: Thomas M. “Tom” Engelhardt (born 1944) is an American writer and editor. He is the creator of The Nation Institute’s tomdispatch.com, an online blog. He is also the co-founder of the American Empire Project and the author of the 1998 book, The End of Victory Culture: Cold War America and the Disillusioning of a Generation. (Wikipedia)  The blog produces outstanding writing with well sourced articles.  Has a moderate left wing bias in reporting.

toinformistoinfluence.com.name: To Inform is to Influence
toinformistoinfluence.com.notes: To Inform is to Influence is a news blog that focuses on politics. Many posts are related to Russia and have a mild anti-Russia bias. Most posts are well sourced and written with minimal loaded words. Story choices are left of center.

thestar.com.name: Toronto Star
thestar.com.notes: The Toronto Star is a Canadian broadsheet daily newspaper. It is Canada’s highest-circulation newspaper.  The Toronto Star is considered Canada’s most liberal major newspaper. Reports with sources.

unicornriot.ninja.name: Unicorn Riot
unicornriot.ninja.notes: Unicorn Riot is a non-profit independent media source that claims to “amplify the voices of the unheard and exposes root causes of social conflict and explores sustainable alternatives in today’s globalized world.”  Using our standard methodology, Unicorn Riot uses mostly neutral language, is factual and uses evidence as support to claims, and they choose to cover stories that appeal to the political left.   Based on their strong use of sourcing and neutral language we rate this source Left-Center.

uft.org.name: United Federation of Teachers (UFT)
uft.org.notes: The United Federation of Teachers (UFT) is the labor union that represents most teachers in New York City public schools. As of 2005, there were about 118,000 in-service teachers and 17,000 paraprofessional educators in the union, as well as about 54,000 retired members (Wikipedia). This source does publish news that is related to education and policy. Reporting is sourced and factual. Has a left-center bias politically through endorsements of democratic candidates.

urban.org.name: Urban Institute
urban.org.notes: The Urban Institute is a Washington DC-based think tank that carries out economic and social policy research.  The Urban Institute was established in 1968 by the Lyndon B. Johnson administration to study the nation’s urban problems and evaluate the Great Society initiatives embodied in more than 400 laws passed in the prior four years. Johnson hand-selected well-known economists and civic leaders to create the non-partisan, independent research organization (Wikipedia).

usnews.com.name: US News World Report
usnews.com.notes: U.S. News & World Report is an American media company that publishes news, opinion, consumer advice, rankings, and analysis.  It is lightly biased toward the left, but generally very reliable for information.

vancouversun.com.name: Vancouver Sun
vancouversun.com.notes: A daily newspaper from Vancouver, Canada. Is factual in reporting with a left-center political bias editorially.

vice.com.name: Vice News
vice.com.notes: Vice News is a news and opinion website that has a left center political bias in reporting.  Sometimes they do not source to credible sources.  Otherwise this source produces strong journalism.

votevets.org.name: VoteVets.org
votevets.org.notes: VoteVets.org is organized as a non-partisan political action committee (PAC) and non-profit 501(c)(4) status in the United States. Although a nonpartisan organization, it has been described as “closely aligned with Congressional Democrats,” and “liberal” in news stories. In a June 2011 press release, the organization specifically identified itself as the “largest progressive group of veterans in America (Wikipedia).

washingtonpost.com.name: Washington Post
washingtonpost.com.notes: The Washington Post is an American daily newspaper. It is the most widely circulated newspaper published in Washington, D.C., and was founded on December 6, 1877.  The newspaper has won 47 Pulitzer Prizes. This includes six separate Pulitzers awarded in 2008, the second-highest number ever awarded to a single newspaper in one year.  Post journalists have also received 18 Nieman Fellowships and 368 White House News Photographers Association awards (Wikipedia). The Washington Post has a liberal bias in reporting choices, however they are typically well sourced to credible information.  Sometimes they rush stories to be the first to break them, which leads to poor sourcing. This has occurred on a few occasions in 2016.  When an error is made the Washington Post responsibly makes corrections.

wgntv.com.name: WGN News
wgntv.com.notes: WGN-TV presently broadcasts 65½ hours of locally produced newscasts each week and has a website with news that derives from the Chicago Tribune. WGN reports accurately and with a slight left of center political bias.

windsorstar.com.name: Windsor Star
windsorstar.com.notes: The Windsor Star is the regional daily newspaper of Windsor, Ontario, Canada. It is owned by the Postmedia Network and published Mondays through Saturdays. Has left-center editorial positions, but is well sourced.

wired.com.name: Wired Magazine
wired.com.notes: Wired Magazine is primarily a tech magazine.  However, they do report news and politics on an occasional basis.  When they do they have a left-center bias in reporting and wording.

wnyc.org.name: WNYC
wnyc.org.notes: WNYC is the trademark, and a set of call letters shared by a pair of non-profit, noncommercial, public radio stations located in New York City.  WNYC (AM) broadcasts on 820 kHz, and WNYC-FM broadcasts on 93.9 MHz. Both stations are owned by New York Public Radio and are members of NPR and carry local and national news/talk programs (Wikipedia). This is the headquarters for NPR.

worldaffairsjournal.org.name: World Affairs Journal
worldaffairsjournal.org.notes: World Affairs and WorldAffairsJournal.org are published by the World Affairs Institute, a newly formed nonpartisan 501(c)3 organization, located in Washington D.C., established to promote public education and awareness on international issues related to war and peace (Wikipedia).

yahoo.com.name: Yahoo News
yahoo.com.notes: Yahoo News curates news from a variety of sources and writers.  Some are not properly sourced.  Overall, Yahoo News tends to have a Left-center bias in reporting and wording.

abc.net.au.name: ABC News Australia
abc.net.au.notes: ABC News is a national news service in Australia produced by the News and Current Affairs division of the Australian Broadcasting Corporation. The division is responsible for all news-gathering and production of news output for ABC television, radio and online services. Although the ABC is owned and funded by the Australian Government, the editorial independence of the ABC is ensured through the Australian Broadcasting Corporation Act (Cwlth) 1983.  (Wikipedia) Low biased reporting of USA news.

afp.com.name: AFP (Agence France Presse)
afp.com.notes: Agence France-Presse (AFP) is a balanced international news agency headquartered in Paris, France. Founded in 1944, AFP is the third largest news agency in the world, after the Associated Press (AP) and Reuters.  AFP is the Reuters of Europe.

africanews.com.name: Africa News
africanews.com.notes: Africanews is a 24-hour news channel based out of Pointe-Noire in the Republic of the Congo. The news channel is a subsidiary of France-based Euronews and began broadcasting online, TV and via Satellite on 20 April 2016 (Wikipedia). Provides straightforward reporting of news with minimal bias.

agerpres.ro.name: Agerpres
agerpres.ro.notes: The National News Agency “AGERPRES” is the oldest Romanian news agency and the first autonomous agency in Romania. Has a slight nationalist bias, but reports USA and western news with minimal bias and excellent sourcing.

english.ahram.org.eg.name: Ahram Online
english.ahram.org.eg.notes: Ahram is the largest circulating paper in Egypt.  Ahram’s headquarters is in Boulaq, Cairo. Its content was controlled by the Egyptian Ministry of Information and has strong nationalistic biases.  However, this source has low bias in reporting news on international affairs.

english.alarabiya.net.name: Al Arabiya
english.alarabiya.net.notes: Al Arabiya is a Saudi owned television and online news station.  They have a strong pro-government bias, but do present low biased coverage of USA news.

albawaba.com.name: Al Bawaba
albawaba.com.notes: Al Bawaba is a news, blogging and media website headquartered in Amman, Jordan with an office in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Al Bawaba was launched in 2000. It publishes news stories related to the Middle East. It has separate English and Arabic sections. Al Bawaba reports international news with minimal bias and sticks with factual reporting and neutral words.

eng.majalla.com.name: Al Majalla
eng.majalla.com.notes: The Majalla offers the readers an overview of the main weekly news, analysis and exclusive reports with a focus on political affairs. The magazine also provides news from USA today, Time Magazine, World Monitor and MEED.  Very centrist reporting regarding American and international affairs.

abqjournal.com.name: Albuquerque Journal
abqjournal.com.notes: The Albuquerque Journal traces its history to 1880. It is the successor to a newspaper called the Golden Gate, which was established in June of that year. In the fall of 1880, the owner of the Golden Gate died and Journal Publishing Company was founded. The first Albuquerque Daily Journal was published on Oct. 14, 1880. (Wikipedia)

english.aawsat.com.name: Asharq Al-Awsat
english.aawsat.com.notes: Asharq Al-Awsat is an Arabic international newspaper headquartered in London.  Although published under the name of a private company, the Saudi Research and Marketing Group, the paper was founded with the approval of the Saudi royal family and government ministers, and is noted for its support of the Saudi government. The newspaper is owned by Faisal bin Salman, a member of the Saudi royal family. (Wikipedia)  This source obviously has a strong bias toward Saudi interests, but is very factual and evidence based in reporting USA and international news.

apnews.com.name: Associated Press
apnews.com.notes: The Associated Press (AP) is an American multinational nonprofit news agency headquartered in New York City that operates as a cooperative, unincorporated association. The AP is owned by its contributing newspapers and radio and television stations in the United States, all of which contribute stories to the AP and use material written by its staff journalists (Wikipedia). Reports breaking news with minimal bias.

afr.com.name: The Australian Financial Review
afr.com.notes: The Australian Financial Review (sometimes abbreviated to AFR) is an Australian business and finance newspaper published by Fairfax Media in a broadsheet format six days a week. Well sourced.

ballotpedia.org.name: Ballotpedia
ballotpedia.org.notes: Ballotpedia is a nonpartisan online political encyclopedia. Founded in 2007, it covers American federal, state, and local politics, elections, and public policy.  Ballotpedia’s stated goal is “to inform people about politics by providing accurate and objective information about politics at all levels of government.” Is always well sourced.

bangkokpost.com.name: The Bangkok Post
bangkokpost.com.notes: The Bangkok Post is a broadsheet, English-language daily newspaper published in Bangkok, Thailand.  Has minimal bias regarding USA news.

en.bbarta24.net.name: Bbarta24
en.bbarta24.net.notes: Bbarta24 is an online news source from Bangladesh. They provide news that does not use loaded language and is factually sourced for international news.

bellingcat.com.name: Bellingcat
bellingcat.com.notes: Bellingcat uses open source and social media investigation to investigate a variety of subjects, from Mexican drug lords to conflicts being fought across the world. Bellingcat brings together contributors who specialize in open source and social media investigation, and creates guides and case studies so others may learn to do the same. Bellingcat primarily covers Russian and Syrian stories.  They source all of their information.

bettergov.org.name: Better Government Association
bettergov.org.notes: The Better Government Association is a Chicago-based investigative journalism non-profit organization.  The Better Government Association’s mission is to work for “integrity, transparency, and accountability in government by exposing corruption and inefficiency; identifying and advocating effective public policy; and engaging and mobilizing the electorate to achieve authentic and responsible reform (Wikipedia).” The BGA performs well sourced investigative reports and has minimal bias in story selection and reporting.

bdnews24.com.name: BDNews24
bdnews24.com.notes: BDNews24 is one of Bangladesh’s leading newspaper/media groups. With an Alexa ranking placing it consistently among the world’s top websites. It has also persisted as the country’s leading English language as well as bilingual English and Bengali website.

bigthink.com.name: Big Think
bigthink.com.notes: Big Think is a web portal that features interviews, multimedia presentations, and roundtable discussions with speakers from a range of fields. I was torn between placing this source in Pro-Science or Least Biased, but because they do some fact checks and also touch on some political issues I felt Least Biased is more appropriate. Everything here is sourced and delivered by experts in the given fields.

thebulletin.org.name: Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists
thebulletin.org.notes: The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists is a nontechnical academic journal, published by Taylor and Francis that covers global security and public policy issues related to the dangers posed by nuclear and other weapons of mass destruction, climate change, and emerging technologies and diseases. It has been published continuously since 1945 (Wikipedia).

carnegieendowment.org.name: Carnegie Endowment for International Peace
carnegieendowment.org.notes: The Carnegie Endowment for International Peace is a foreign-policy think tank with centers in Washington, D.C., Moscow, Beirut, Beijing, Brussels, and New Delhi. The organization describes itself as being dedicated to advancing cooperation between nations and promoting active international engagement by the United States. Founded in 1910 by Andrew Carnegie, its work is not formally associated with any political party (Wikipedia).

castanet.net.name: Castanet
castanet.net.notes: Castanet is news website located in British Columbia’s Okanagan Valley.  Provides low biased straightforward reporting that is well sourced.

c4ads.org.name: Center for Advanced Defense Studies
c4ads.org.notes: The Center for Advanced Defense Studies is a nonprofit research organization that employs academics, national security operators, and local experts from existing and emerging conflict zones around the world. It works to address evolving and nontraditional security challenges.

cgdev.org.name: Center for Global Development
cgdev.org.notes: Independent and Non-Partisan group that works to reduce global poverty and inequality through rigorous research and active engagement with the policy community to make the world a more prosperous, just, and safe place for us all.

centerforinquiry.net.name: Center for Inquiry
centerforinquiry.net.notes: The Center for Inquiry is a nonprofit educational organization. Its primary mission is to foster a secular society based on science, reason, freedom of inquiry, and humanist values.

cnas.org.name: Center for a New American Security
cnas.org.notes: The Center for a New American Security (CNAS) is a Washington, D.C.-based think tank established in 2007 by co-founders Michèle Flournoy and Kurt M. Campbell which specializes in U.S. national security issues.

publicintegrity.org.name: Center for Public Integrity
publicintegrity.org.notes: Founded in 1989. One of the country’s oldest and largest nonpartisan, nonprofit investigative news organizations. Mission is to serve democracy by revealing abuses of power, corruption and betrayal of public trust by powerful public and private institutions, using the tools of investigative journalism. Winner of Pulitzer Prize in 2014.

opensecrets.org.name: Center for Responsive Politics (Open Secrets)
opensecrets.org.notes: Nonpartisan, independent and nonprofit, the Center for Responsive Politics is the nation’s premier research group tracking money in U.S. politics and its effect on elections and public policy.  Also known as Open Secrets.

csis.org.name: Center for Strategic and International Studies
csis.org.notes: Established over 50 years ago, the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) is a bipartisan, nonprofit policy research organization dedicated to providing strategic insights and policy solutions to help decision-makers chart a course toward a better world.

chinadaily.com.cn.name: China Daily
chinadaily.com.cn.notes: Daily Chinese newspaper with balanced coverage of USA News.

csmonitor.com.name: Christian Science Monitor
csmonitor.com.notes: The Christian Science Monitor (CSM) is an international news organization that delivers global coverage via its website, weekly magazine, daily news briefing, email newsletters, Amazon Kindle subscription, and mobile site. It was started in 1908 by Mary Baker Eddy, the founder of the Church of Christ, Scientist. As of 2011, the print circulation was 75,052 (Wikipedia). The Christian Science Monitor has a very slight left leaning bias in reporting, but is always factual. The bias is not enough to move this source and hence it is least biased.

ced.org.name: Committee for Economic Development
ced.org.notes: The Committee for Economic Development (CED) is a business-led public policy organization based in Washington, D.C. Its membership consists primarily of senior corporate executives from a range of U.S. industries and sectors. Together with its members, CED aims to sustain and promote free enterprise, improve education and healthcare, reform campaign finance, enhance corporate governance, and improve the fiscal health of the United States (Wikipedia).  Leans right, but is always factual and does not use loaded words.

crfb.org.name: Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget
crfb.org.notes: The Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget (CRFB) is an independent, non-profit, bipartisan public policy organization based in Washington, D.C. that addresses federal budget and fiscal issues. CRFB focuses on many issues including deficit reduction, “entitlement” reform, fundamental tax reform, improving the budget process, and other topical issues as they arise.  It was founded in 1981 by former United States Representatives Robert Giaimo (D-CT) and Henry Bellmon (R-OK), and its board of directors includes former Members of Congress and directors of the Office of Management and Budget, the Congressional Budget Office and the Federal Reserve.  (Wikipedia) This is an excellent source for statistical based information regarding government budgets.

cpj.org.name: Committee to Protect Journalists
cpj.org.notes: The Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) is an American independent non-profit, non-governmental organization, based in New York City, New York with correspondents around the world. CPJ promotes press freedom and defends the rights of journalists (Wikipedia). Reports with minimal bias and is factually sourced.

conflict-news.com.name: Conflict News
conflict-news.com.notes: Utilizes citizen reports about conflicts around the world.  The bias of this source must be determined by the individual writer of the articles.  Seems pretty straightforward.  We will monitor this source and change accordingly.

conservationmagazine.org.name: Conservation Magazine
conservationmagazine.org.notes: Science and evidence based reporting on “Green” issues from the University of Washington.

consortiumnews.com.name: Consortium News
consortiumnews.com.notes: Consortium News is an alternative independent news source established in 1995.  It is considered the first alternative investigative journalism internet news source.  Consortium News covers stories deeply and has been responsible for uncovering scandals and important information that was not found/covered by the mainstream media.  They are factual and evidence based, but present information with a slight left of center tone.

constitutionproject.org.name: Constitution Project
constitutionproject.org.notes: The Constitution Project brings together policy experts and legal practitioners from across the political spectrum to foster consensus-based solutions to the most difficult constitutional challenges of our time.

cookpolitical.com.name: Cook Political Report
cookpolitical.com.notes: The Cook Political Report is an independent, non-partisan online newsletter/website that analyzes elections and campaigns for the United States House of Representatives, the United States Senate, Governor’s offices and the American Presidency (Wikipedia). Founded in 1984, it is considered one of the best nonpartisan political trackers .

blog.countable.us.name: Countable News
blog.countable.us.notes: Countable is a news website/blog that presents news with minimal bias.  All stories are sourced with links and the writers typically cover both sides of the story on political issues.

c-span.org.name: C-Span
c-span.org.notes: Live access to congress and straightforward government news. Zero bias.

earth.columbia.edu.name: Earth Institute
earth.columbia.edu.notes: Science and evidenced based reporting on the earth sciences.  From Columbia University.

eurasiagroup.net.name: Eurasia Group
eurasiagroup.net.notes: Eurasia Group is the world’s largest political risk consultancy.  Eurasia Group is generally recognized to be the first to systematically bring political science as a discipline to Wall Street. This approach includes the Eurasia Group Global Political Risk Index (GPRI)—the first qualitative comparative political and economic risk index designed specifically to measure stability in emerging markets (Wikipedia).

euronews.com.name: Euronews
euronews.com.notes: Euronews is a European multilingual news media service, headquartered in Lyon, France. Created in 1993, it aims to cover world news from a pan-European perspective (Wikipedia). Present news with neutral wording and appropriate sourcing.

everycrsreport.com.name: Every CRS Report
everycrsreport.com.notes: CRS (Congressional Research Service) is Congress’ think tank, and its reports are relied upon by academics, businesses, judges, policy advocates, students, librarians, journalists, and policymakers for accurate and timely analysis of important policy issues. The reports are not classified and do not contain individualized advice to any specific member of Congress.  These are the unbiased reports presented to Congress.

factcheck.org.name: FactCheck
factcheck.org.notes: FactCheck.org is a nonprofit website that describes itself as a non-partisan “consumer advocate for voters that aims to reduce the level of deception and confusion in U.S. politics”. It is a project of the Annenberg Public Policy Center of the Annenberg School for Communication at the University of Pennsylvania, and is funded primarily by the Annenberg Foundation. FactCheck.org has won four Webby Awards in the Politics category, in 2008, 2010, 2011 and 2012 (Wikipedia).  Well sourced unbiased fact checking.

factscan.ca.name: FactsCan
factscan.ca.notes: FactsCan is a Canadian political fact checking website similar to Politifact.  It is well sourced and impartial.

financialexpress.com.name: Financial Express
financialexpress.com.notes: The Financial Express is an Indian English-language business newspaper. They specialize in India and international business and financial news.

ft.com.name: Financial Times
ft.com.notes: The Financial Times (FT) is an English-language international daily newspaper with a special emphasis on business and economic news.  Reports news with minimal bias.  Has an editorial stance that ranges from right-center to left-center.  On a whole this is a balanced source.

foreignaffairs.com.name: Foreign Affairs
foreignaffairs.com.notes: Foreign Affairs is an American journal of international relations and U.S. foreign policy. It has been published bimonthly since 1922 by the Council on Foreign Relations, a nonprofit, 4,900-member organization, think tank and publisher that specializes in U.S. foreign policy and international affairs.

foreignpolicy.com.name: Foreign Policy
foreignpolicy.com.notes: Foreign Policy is an American news publication, founded in 1970 and focused on global affairs, current events, and domestic and international policy. It produces content daily on its website and in six print issues annually (Wikipedia). Low bias and well sourced.

fullfact.org.name: Full Fact (UK)
fullfact.org.notes: Full Fact is an independent fact checking organization based in the UK which aims to “promote accuracy in public debate”, launched in 2009.  Well sourced.

gallup.com.name: Gallup
gallup.com.notes: Gallup, Inc. is an American research-based, global performance-management consulting company. Founded by George Gallup in 1935, the company became known for its public opinion polls conducted worldwide. It provides research and strategic consulting to large organizations in many countries, focusing on “analytics and advice to help leaders and organizations solve their most pressing problems (Wikipedia).” Provides low biased information.

govexec.com.name: Government Executive
govexec.com.notes: Government Executive is an American trade magazine, founded in 1969. It was purchased in 1987 by National Journal, which itself was purchased in 1997 by the Atlantic Media Company, owned by David Bradley. The magazine is distributed free to senior executives in federal, state and local governments. In 2009, the independent research firm Market Connections, Inc. cited the magazine as the number one publication read by federal managers (Wikipedia). Low Bias and well sourced.

govtrack.us.name: GovTrack
govtrack.us.notes: GovTrack.us enables its users to track the bills and members of the United States Congress. Users can add trackers to certain bills. The website collects data on members of Congress, allowing the users to check voting records and attendance relative to peers (Wikipedia). There is no bias in reporting and it is factual. This is a resource to track official information.

globalintegrity.org.name: Global Integrity
globalintegrity.org.notes: Located in Washington, D.C., USA, Global Integrity provides empirically-supported information which analyzes corruption and governance trends.

news.grabien.com.name: Grabien News
news.grabien.com.notes: Grabien is a news aggregation website that pulls news from a variety source.  Some of these sources are far right and left, however, Grabien itself is considered least biased because they are presenting news from many sources.  It is up to the reader to determine the bias of those sources.  Grabien also has a feature where they present live video feeds from news stations.

harvardpolitics.com.name: Harvard Political Review
harvardpolitics.com.notes: The Harvard Political Review is a quarterly, nonpartisan American magazine and website on politics and public policy founded in 1969 at Harvard University in Cambridge, Massachusetts. It covers both domestic and international affairs and political events, as well as political discourse at Harvard. It also conducts interviews with political figures and experts. It is a publication of the Harvard Institute of Politics, and is written, edited and managed entirely by Harvard undergraduates, and accepts submissions from all students at Harvard College “regardless of concentration, experience, or political leaning (Wikipedia).”

hoax-slayer.com.name: Hoax Slayer
hoax-slayer.com.notes: Evidence based debunking of internet hoaxes.

ivn.us.name: Independent Voter Network (IVN)
ivn.us.notes: From the IVN about page: “The purpose of IVN.us is to provide unfiltered political news and policy analysis across the political spectrum.
