modernalternativemama.com.notes: Modern Alternative Mama is a blog about parenting and raising children. There is some credible information about education and discipline on the this website, but there is also a whole section dedicated to the Anti-Vaccination pseudoscience.

morningledger.com.name: Morning Ledger
morningledger.com.notes: Your basic conspiracy site that seems to be hung up on WW III.

naturalawakeningsmag.com.name: Natural Awakenings Magazine
naturalawakeningsmag.com.notes: Natural Awakenings is a Holistic Health magazine that was launched in 1994.  The magazine publishes questionable science. According to Quackwatch this is non-recommended periodical due to pseudoscience.

naturalnews.com.name: Natural News
naturalnews.com.notes: Does publish legit content, but also a lot of Pseudoscience and ridiculous medical claims.

newsinsideout.com.name: NewsInsideOut.com
newsinsideout.com.notes: NewsInsideOut.com is a conspiracy website that covers such topics as Aliens, New World Order, Mind Control and False Flag Operations.

newstarget.com.name: News Target
newstarget.com.notes: News Target produces mostly right wing biased propaganda, but also publishes a good deal of unproven pseudosciences. For that reason we are placing them in this category. They do publish some legitimate news, so beware when using them as a source.

nodisinfo.com.name: NoDisInfo
nodisinfo.com.notes: Conspiracy theories and that is all.

nowtheendbegins.com.name: Now the End Begins
nowtheendbegins.com.notes: Right wing conspiracies.  End of times Christianity.

pakalertpress.com.name: Pak Alert Press
pakalertpress.com.notes: Pak Alert Press is a website dedicated to New World Order and Illuminati conspiracies.

peta.org.name: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)
peta.org.notes: People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) is an American animal rights organization based in Norfolk, Virginia, and led by Ingrid Newkirk, its international president. While PETA does publish some actual credible and important information they also heavily promote pseudoscience. One example is their promotion of milk as a cause for autism. To learn more about other pseudosciences they peddle check out Rationalwiki.

politicalblindspot.com.name: Political Blind Spot
politicalblindspot.com.notes: Hard to tell if this is satire or conspiracy or serious.

prisonplanet.com.name: Prison Planet
prisonplanet.com.notes: Prison Planet is a news and opinion website associated with Alex Jones (Infowars). It contains the same tin foil conspiracies, but has a more right wing political bias than Infowars.

prophecytoday.com.name: Prophecy Today
prophecytoday.com.notes: A christian news website.  Focuses on end of times and other myths related to the bible.

propornot.com.name: Prop Or Not
propornot.com.notes: Prop or Not claims to be “a resource for people who want to understand Russian influence operations targeted at US audiences, distinguish between propaganda and commercial “clickbait”, and help identify propaganda and push back.  They have published a rather large list of media outlets that are either directly working for the Russian’s or unknowingly spreading Russian propaganda.  This source also does not give details about who they are as they fear retaliation from the Russians.  Seriously, they said this. Some of the sources listed as Russian Propagandist are simply ridiculous as they have zero to do with politics.  For now we are placing this site on our conspiracy list as their is very little evidence to support their claims.  If this changes we will move this site to a different category.

realfarmacy.com.name: RealFarmacy
realfarmacy.com.notes: RealFarmacy is considered one of the worst science websites on the internet. They routinely publish ridiculous holistic cures and promote anti-Vaxx conspiracies. They generally go against the consensus of science and do not source information. If you trust the information contained on this website you literally are endangering yourself.

reflectionofmind.org.name: Reflection of Mind
reflectionofmind.org.notes: Reflection of Mind is a news and opinion website that routinely publishes pseudoscience and conspiracy theories. Example: NASA Claims Aliens are Communicating with Earth.

rense.com.name: Rense
rense.com.notes: The page is filled with ads which makes it hard to even locate the content.  The content is conspiratorial and extremely racist. Has an absolute disdain and crackpot fear of Muslims.

debunkingskeptics.com.name: SCEPCOP (Debunking Skeptics)
debunkingskeptics.com.notes: One of the most ridiculous websites out there.  They attempt to refute actual evidence with a combination of pseudoscience and conspiracies.  Total nonsense.  Their website also is listed as Untrustworthy by the Web of Trust.

sott.net.name: Signs of the Times (SOTT)
sott.net.notes: Signs of the Times is a news and opinion website that tends to focus on conspiracy theories and pseudoscience. They have quite a bit of legitimate news, but some of the outrageous stories overshadow it.

secretsofthefed.com.name: Secrets of the Fed
secretsofthefed.com.notes: Typical New Word Order and Illuminati conspiracies. Does post some legitimate news.

sheepkillers.com.name: Sheep Killers
sheepkillers.com.notes: A combination of biblical literalism and the New World Order.  Off the charts craziness.

shoebat.com.name: Shoebat
shoebat.com.notes: Shoebat.com was founded by Walid Shoebat, a Muslim-turned-Christian journalist. His son, Theodore Shoebat, also provides articles occasionally. Content primarily includes criticism of Islam including Christian end times conspiracies. Strongly promotes homophobia.

skeptiko.com.name: Skeptiko
skeptiko.com.notes: Ridiculous claims of pseudoscience and conspiracies.  Founder of the website wrote a book called “Science is Wrong.”

southfront.org.name: South Front
southfront.org.notes: Claims to be non-profit and non-partisan, but is mostly a right wing site that presents some biased conspiracies.  Certainly not the worst conspiracy site as they balance with real news reporting.

sitsshow.blogspot.com.name: Stillness in the Storm
sitsshow.blogspot.com.notes: Stillness in the Storm is a news and opinion blog with over-the-top tin foil hat conspiracy theories.

stormcloudsgathering.com.name: Storm Clouds Gathering
stormcloudsgathering.com.notes: Mostly conspiracies presented such as world war III and pseudoscientific cures.

sustainablepulse.com.name: Sustainable Pulse
sustainablepulse.com.notes: Sustainable Pulse provides the general public with the latest global news on GMOs, Sustainable Food and Sustainable Agriculture from their network of worldwide sources.  This source is 100% anti-GMO and does not present valid science based on the consensus that GMO’s are safe.  This is mostly a propaganda campaign.

theantimedia.org.name: The Anti-Media
theantimedia.org.notes: The Anti-Media mostly publishes conspiracy stories, but does occasionally produce a factual evidence based report.  This site is not very trustworthy and needs fact checking from credible sources.

thecommonsenseshow.com.name: The Common Sense Show
thecommonsenseshow.com.notes: It is only common sense if you believe right wing conspiracies.

thecontroversialfiles.net.name: The Controversial Files
thecontroversialfiles.net.notes: A combination of both conspiracy and pseudoscience with a strong right wing bais.

corbettreport.com.name: The Corbett Report
corbettreport.com.notes: The Corbett Reports is a right wing biased conspiracy site. Some featured topics are the New World Order, 9-11 conspiracies and of course false flag operations. There are many more.

eutimes.net.name: The European Union Times
eutimes.net.notes: A combination of real news stories and conspiracies.

theeventchronicle.com.name: The Event Chronicle
theeventchronicle.com.notes: Aliens, government conspiracies, anti-vax and other quackery.  This one is extreme.

theinternetpost.net.name: The Internet Post
theinternetpost.net.notes: The Internet Post is a blog that claims the mainstream media lies and that this blog is the answer. If you are an anti-vaxxer or climate science denier then perhaps the answers are here. This site also veers toward right wing propaganda.

thelibertybeacon.com.name: The Liberty Beacon
thelibertybeacon.com.notes: Mostly right wing biased conspiracy theories with a healthy dose of unscientific quackery.

themindunleashed.org.name: The Mind Unleashed
themindunleashed.org.notes: Your average conspiracy and pseudoscience website.

therundownlive.com.name: The Rundown Live
therundownlive.com.notes: Very crazy conspiracy theories.  Illuminati, aliens and crazy discoveries.

stream.org.name: The Stream
stream.org.notes: Not to be confused with Al Jazeera’s program called the Stream. The Stream is an online news and opinion website that is overtly Christian. It has a strong right wing bias and advocates for Creationism.  Due to its many positions that are contrary to science we are placing this right wing site in this category due to pseudoscience.

thetrumpet.com.name: The Trumpet
thetrumpet.com.notes: The Philadelphia Trumpet also known as The Trumpet is a free of charge monthly magazine published by the Philadelphia Church of God, also available online. The magazine’s focus is on domestic and international current events, societal commentary, and Bible based self-help articles, which often source Biblical writing as prophecy relating to world events (Wikipedia). The Trumpet does publish credible news and also aggregates news from other credible sources, however many stories that are written by The Trumpet attempt to relate current events to biblical prophecy.

thetruthaboutcancer.com.name: The Truth About Cancer
thetruthaboutcancer.com.notes: This website is all about cancer.  While there is legitimate information of this site, it is also littered with pseudoscience, alternative medicine and nutrition.  Stick with American Cancer Society and credible journals.  Do not rely on this site for information if you value your health.

thetruthseeker.co.uk.name: The Truth Seeker
thetruthseeker.co.uk.notes: If you are seeking this truth this is the wrong place to find it.

wakingtimes.com.name: The Waking Times
wakingtimes.com.notes: The Waking Times is left biased news and opinion website that promotes pseudoscience and some conspiracy regarding politics. While they do publish some credible information there is enough incredible information on this site to classify it here.

topinfopost.com.name: Topinfo Post
topinfopost.com.notes: Crazy conspiracy theories that consist of nuclear war, aliens and anti-science propaganda.

truepundit.com.name: True Pundit
truepundit.com.notes: Though they do occasionally publish a legitimate story, most are conspiracies.  This source also currently delivers news straight from the Daily Caller which has a strong right-wing bias. Most articles from True Pundit have an anonymous authors.  Simply not trustworthy.

trunews.com.name: TruNews
trunews.com.notes: The Trunews radio program is hosted by Rick Wiles a far right Christian Fundamentalist.  His show has a strong right wing bias that supports conspiracy theories.  The most common theme is End of Times.

truthandaction.org.name: Truth and Action
truthandaction.org.notes: Not so sure about the truth part, but it does seem to be a right wing propaganda and conspiracy site.

truthbroadcastnetwork.com.name: Truth Broadcasting Network
truthbroadcastnetwork.com.notes: No truth to be found here.  Just conspiracies.

truthchannelpolitics.com.name: Truth Channel Politics
truthchannelpolitics.com.notes: Truth Channel Politics (News) is a news and opinion blog with a pro-right bias that is very concerned about the New World Order.

undergroundhealth.com.name: Underground Health
undergroundhealth.com.notes: Here is a sample article headline: Chemtrails Killing Organic Crops and Monsanto’s GMO Seeds Thrive.  Need I say more?

veteranstoday.com.name: Veterans Today
veteranstoday.com.notes: Mostly conspiracies related to the military.

vigilantcitizen.com.name: Vigilant Citizen
vigilantcitizen.com.notes: Vigilant Citizen promotes conspiracy theories involving aliens and mind control.  They also promote pseudoscience.

voiceofamericatv.com.name: Voice of America TV (voiceofamericatv.com)
voiceofamericatv.com.notes: Voiceofamericatv.com is not to be confused with the credible Voice of America that has minimal bias.  Voice of America TV is an extreme right wing conspiracy site.  Nothing more.  Nothing less.

wattsupwiththat.com.name: Watts Up with That
wattsupwiththat.com.notes: Watts Up with That is a 100% climate denial website. They cite junk science and reject the consensus of climate scientist globally in the pursuit of their denial.

anonhq.com.name: We Are Anonymous
anonhq.com.notes: Simply not reliable.  Deals in conspiracy theories and rarely offers credible evidence.

wearechange.org.name: We Are Change
wearechange.org.notes: We Are Change is an independent media organization comprised of activist groups who promote right-libertarian values along with a wide variety of conspiracy theories such as the New World Order and 9/11 false flag operations.

whale.to.name: Whale.to
whale.to.notes: This source contains every conspiracy and pseudoscience woo known to humankind. We mean it.  Everything is here.

whatdoesitmean.com.name: WhatDoesItMean
whatdoesitmean.com.notes: Over the top conspiracies and pseudoscience.  This site is so crazy even conspiracy theorists reject it.  If this was satire it could possibly be funny.  It’s not!

whydontyoutrythis.com.name: Why Don’t You Try This
whydontyoutrythis.com.notes: A healthy dose of Pseudoscience. We strongly recommend you “don’t try this.”

wikispooks.com.name: Wikispooks
wikispooks.com.notes: Wikispooks is open source wiki that is designed for conspiracy theorists. Their sourcing criteria is not credible.

worldtruth.tv.name: World Truth TV
worldtruth.tv.notes: Go elsewhere for truth.  It isn’t here. Crazy conspiracies and ridiculous science.

yournewswire.com.name: Your News Wire
yournewswire.com.notes: This site has some legit news, but there is quite a few conspiracies mixed in. This site is mostly a clickbait.

zerohedge.com.name: Zero Hedge
zerohedge.com.notes: Zero Hedge is a financial blog that aggregates news and presents editorial opinions from original and outside sources.  In between the aggregated news there are crazy economic conspiracies and general right wing biases.

bizstandardnews.com.name: Business Standard News (BS News)
bizstandardnews.com.notes: From the BS News website: “The Business Standard News is a satirical site designed to parody the 24-hour news cycle. The stories are outlandish, but reality is so strange nowadays they could be true.”

encyclopediadramatica.se.name: Encyclopedia Dramatica
encyclopediadramatica.se.notes: Satire. Encyclopedia Dramatica is a satirical website, consisting of a wiki that uses MediaWiki software. Launched on December 10, 2004, it lampoons encyclopedia topics and current events, especially those related or relevant to contemporary Internet culture.

harddawn.com.name: Hard Dawn
harddawn.com.notes: Satire aimed at Trump and the right.

thehardtimes.net.name: The Hard Times
thehardtimes.net.notes: Satire. The Hard Times is a satire punk rock magazine.

theonion.com.name: The Onion
theonion.com.notes: Satire.  Perhaps the most famous satire site of all time.

outabouter.com.name: The Out and Abouter
outabouter.com.notes: From the Out and Abouter about page: “A boutique satirical website (which means I write these in an unheated shed in my backyard) with a focus on things inane, and Canadian.”

theseattletribune.com.name: The Seattle Tribune
theseattletribune.com.notes: From the Seattle Tribune disclaimer: “The Seattle Tribune is a news and entertainment satire web publication.”

times.com.mx.name: The Times
times.com.mx.notes: Appears to be a combination of satire and some fake news.

witscience.org.name: Wyoming Institute of Technology (WIT)
witscience.org.notes: Satire. Publishes fake science news that can be either humorous or deceptive.

abcnews.com.co.name: AbcNews.com.co
abcnews.com.co.notes: Fake News site that looks like ABC News.

allenwestrepublic.com.name: Allen West Republic
allenwestrepublic.com.notes: A website created by a fan of Allen West.  The website publishes information about Allen West and also highly biased right wing news stories. This source produces propaganda and has a poor track record with facts since it reports about Allen West.

americasfreedomfighters.com.name: Americas Freedom Fighters
americasfreedomfighters.com.notes: America’s Freedom Fighters is a news and opinion website that has over the top right wing bias.  Routinely publishes conspiracy theories and is factually void.

americanlookout.com.name: American Lookout
americanlookout.com.notes: American Lookout is a conservative news and opinion site.  Has a very strong to extreme right wing bias and does not source to credible information. Promotes propaganda.

americannews.com.name: American News
americannews.com.notes: American News is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion site.  Poorly sourced with minimal basis in facts.

amren.com.name: American Renaissance Magazine
amren.com.notes: American Renaissance (AR or AmRen) is a monthly online magazine published by the New Century Foundation which describes itself as a “race-realist, white advocacy organization”. It has been described as a white supremacist publication by several sources, including The Washington Post, Fortune, and the Anti-Defamation League.  According to the Southern Poverty Law Center “AR is a self-styled think tank that promotes pseudo-scientific studies and research that purport to show the inferiority of blacks to whites — although in language that avoids open racial slurs and attempts to portray itself as serious scholarship.”

americanupdater.com.name: American Updater
americanupdater.com.notes: Extreme right bias.  Absolutely ridiculous right wing conspiracies.  Often publishes articles with overt racism and Islamophobia.

barenakedislam.com.name: Bare Naked Islam
barenakedislam.com.notes: Extreme Islamophobia and racism.  This is a hate group.

bb4sp.com.name: BB4SP
bb4sp.com.notes: BB4SP is an online news and opinion source.  The site consists of extreme right wing news, some conspiracy and pretty blunt racism. This source does source information well.

beforeitsnews.com.name: Before it’s News
beforeitsnews.com.notes: Before It’s News is a citizens journalism website where stories are provided by individuals without credentials.  Stories can range from moderately credible to tin-foil hat conspiracies. It seems this source has become a haven for conspiracy theorists and pseudo-scientists.  Further, the website is riddled with pop-up ads and potential malware that make it impossible and unsafe to navigate. This source has been classified as Fake News by Fake News Watch.

bigbluevision.org.name: Big Blue Vision
bigbluevision.org.notes: Big Blue Vision is an extreme right biased news source.  They do not shy from conspiracies and virtually everything they report has factual issues due to lack of credible sources.

blackgenocide.org.name: Black Genocide
blackgenocide.org.notes: Black Genocide is a radical anti-abortion website that promotes the idea that Black’s have been targeted to have abortions.  This site relies on very old debunked conspiracies and consistently fails in fact checking.

cbsnews.com.co.name: CBSNews.com.co
cbsnews.com.co.notes: A fake news website that looks like CBS News.

cis.org.name: Center for Immigration Studies (CIS)
cis.org.notes: The Center for Immigration Studies (CIS) is a non-profit research organization that “that favors far lower immigration numbers and produces research to further those views.” It was started as a spin-off from John Tanton’s Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR) in 1985. Reports published by the CIS have been widely deemed misleading and riddled with basic errors by scholars on immigration; think tanks from across the ideological and political spectrum; media of all stripes; several leading nonpartisan immigration-research organizations; and by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement. The organization has also drawn criticism for its financial and intellectual ties to extremist racists. The Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC) published reports in 2002 and 2009 connecting CIS to John Tanton, who helped found various other organizations, including the Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR) and NumbersUSA, and showing he has ties to white supremacy groups and a eugenics foundation (Wikipedia).

clashdaily.com.name: Clash Daily
clashdaily.com.notes: Clash Daily is a website founded by Doug Giles, an extreme christian right pastor.  The content of the website is extreme right wing that often is not factual, unscientific and biased.  It demonstrates opposition toward LGBT people, atheists and Muslims through wording and political affiliation.

cnn.com.de.name: Cnn.com.de
cnn.com.de.notes: Fake News website that looks similar to CNN.

conservativedailypost.com.name: Conservative Daily Post
conservativedailypost.com.notes: The Conservative Daily Post is a news and opinion website that is hard to determine if it is satire or real.  If it is real then it is off the charts right wing propaganda and conspiracy. Others have classified this as fake news.

conservativefighters.com.name: Conservative Fighters
conservativefighters.com.notes: Conservative Fighters is a news and opinion website that does not source to credible sources, if at all.  The bias is extreme right and racist in context. For every credible article there are 9 that are conspiracy or propaganda.

conservapedia.com.name: Conservapedia
conservapedia.com.notes: Conservapedia is an English-language wiki encyclopedia project written from an American conservative, Young Earth creationist, and Christian fundamentalist point of view. This website is not credible for science information and a lot of reports are simply false.

conservative101.com.name: Conservative 101
conservative101.com.notes: Conservative 101 is a news and opinion website with an extreme right wing bias.  This source routinely publishes conspiracy theories and has been accused of publishing fake news.  This source could easily be listed in our Conspiracy category, but because of it’s one sided right wing bias we will place it here.  This website has zero credibility as a news source.

conservativespirit.com.name: Conservative Spirit
conservativespirit.com.notes: Conservative Spirit is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website.  A lot of information is factually inaccurate and they publish conspiracies such as the Clinton’s murdering people.  Total nonsense.

conservativetribune.com.name: Conservative Tribune
conservativetribune.com.notes: Blatant right wing/conservative bias.  Consistently fails fact checks, supports racism through glorifying violence against African Americans and Muslims and promotes conspiracies.

conservative-headlines.com.name: Council of Concerned Citizens
conservative-headlines.com.notes: The Council of Conservative Citizens (CofCC) is an American far-right organization that supports a large variety of conservative and paleoconservative causes in addition to white nationalism and white separatism. Its Statement of Principles says that they “oppose all efforts to mix the races of mankind”. Several members of the CofCC Board of Directors are former leaders of the segregationist Citizens’ Councils of America (Wikipedia). Not much to add here.  This is a hate group.

dailybuzzlive.com.name: Daily Buzz Live
dailybuzzlive.com.notes: They don’t have an about page so we can’t determine if this is meant to be satire or not. We will just call it Fake News.

dailyheadlines.net.name: Daily Headlines
dailyheadlines.net.notes: An overtly right wing biased propaganda and conspiracy site.  Very little factual information.  Is classified as a fake news source by multiple outlets.

dailyinfobox.com.name: Daily Infobox
dailyinfobox.com.notes: Daily Infobox is an extreme right news and opinion website. Since there isn’t an about page claiming this is satire, we are assuming this is simply a fake news site. Contains ridiculous stories that have been refuted over and over. Total nonsense clickbait!

dailystormer.com.name: Daily Stormer
dailystormer.com.notes: The Daily Stormer is an American neo-Nazi and white supremacist news and commentary website. It is part of the alt-right movement. Its editor is Andrew Anglin, who founded it on July 4, 2013, as a faster-paced replacement for his previous website Total Fascism (Wikipedia). This source is not worthy of a click. It is flat out sickening racism and antisemitism.

denverguardian.com.name: Denver Guardian
denverguardian.com.notes: Fake News. The Denver Guardian posted one fake article that made it’s rounds in social media.  Interestingly, the Denver Guardian does not exist.  According to a Denver Post article they simply do not exist.

thedcgazette.com.name: DC Gazette
thedcgazette.com.notes: The DC Gazette churns out propaganda and conspiracy.  Some of the news is fake and some is credible, but all of it has a very strong right wing bias.

donaldtrumpnews.co.name: Donald Trump News
donaldtrumpnews.co.notes: Fake News (propaganda, disinformation, conspiracy) stories with an extreme right wing bias.

downtrend.com.name: Downtrend
downtrend.com.notes: An extreme right-wing online news source.  The content generally consists of right-wing political conspiracy theories and does not rely on evidence.  Some articles seem to be satire or perhaps it really is that extreme.  Has racist content.

eaglerising.com.name: Eagle Rising
eaglerising.com.notes: Eagle Rising is an extreme right wing biased news website.  Most information is not sourced and there are numerous conspiracy theories espoused. Eagle rising has been cited as fake news by many different sources.

embols.com.name: Embols
embols.com.notes: Embols recently wound up on a list by an Assistant Professor of Communications and Media.  However, this list has been widely circulated and criticized for liberal bias. Embols is a news reporting site that takes information from other sources and repackages it.  In reviewing this site we found one article that sourced a fake story from a conspiracy site.  Most others were just poorly sourced.

endingthefed.com.name: Ending the Fed News
endingthefed.com.notes: Ending the Fed is an extreme right wing biased conspiracy website. There is little sourced information with most articles consisting of propaganda or outright fake news.

frc.org.name: Family Research Council
frc.org.notes: The Family Research Council (FRC) is an American conservative Christian group and lobbying organization formed in the United States in 1981 by James Dobson.  Tony Perkins is its current president.  The FRC promotes traditional family values, by advocating and lobbying for socially conservative policies. It opposes and lobbies against LGBT rights, abortion, divorce, embryonic stem-cell research and pornography.  In 2010, the Southern Poverty Law Center (SPLC) classified the FRC as an anti-gay hate group. (Wikipedia)

focusonthefamily.com.name: Focus on the Family
focusonthefamily.com.notes: Focus on the Family is an American Christian conservative organization founded in 1977 by psychologist James Dobson, based in Colorado Springs, Colorado. It is active in promoting an interdenominational effort toward its socially conservative views on public policy. Has a very extreme right wing bias in reporting.

freakoutnation.com.name: Freakout Nation
freakoutnation.com.notes: Freakout Nation is a web based publication with an overt left wing bias.  Does not always have reliable information that is backed up with sources. Sometimes delves into conspiracies and always promotes propaganda..

freedomdaily.com.name: Freedom Daily
freedomdaily.com.notes: Freedom Daily is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion site.  Uses inflammatory language to describe liberals, minorities and Muslims.  Often does not source to credible information.

freedomlibertynews.com.name: Freedom Liberty News
freedomlibertynews.com.notes: Freedom Liberty News is a news and opinion website that publishes extreme right propaganda and disinformation. This source uses racists language and is anti-muslim.

freedomoutpost.com.name: Freedom Outpost
freedomoutpost.com.notes: Freedom Outpost is an extreme right wing news website.  It is ironic that it has the name freedom in its title because most of the content appears to be about denying freedom for non-Christians.  The site is filled with right wing conspiracies, propaganda and contains racist content.

fury.news.name: Fury News
fury.news.notes: Fury News is an extreme right wing news and opinion site.  This source is very “furious” with liberals, African Americans, Muslims and the poor.  They utilize racist language and either intentionally or not, publish fake news from other overtly right wing propaganda sites.  This source ranks as one of the worst we have rated.

globalinfotoday.com.name: Global Info Today
globalinfotoday.com.notes: Global Info Today is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. Uses loaded words, promotes propaganda and does not source to credible information.

goneleft.com.name: Gone Left
goneleft.com.notes: Gone Left is a news website/blog that has an extreme left wing bias.  This source does not shy away from conspiracy theories and promotes left wing propaganda.  This site is also lacking an about page and therefore lacks credibility.

hangthebankers.com.name: Hang the Bankers
hangthebankers.com.notes: A news and opinion website that has extreme right wing bias in reporting and does not source facts well.  Promotes propaganda.

ihavethetruth.com.name: I have the Truth
ihavethetruth.com.notes: I have the Truth is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website.  Contains propaganda and racism.

ilovemyfreedom.org.name: I Love My Freedom
ilovemyfreedom.org.notes: I Love My Freedom is a news and opinion website.  After a few moments on this website you will see that the only freedom loved here is for White Christian Males.  This source is extremely anti-islam and promotes conspiracy theories.

itaglive.com.name: iTag Live
itaglive.com.notes: A mix of Satire and Fake News

informedowners.com.name: Informed Owners
informedowners.com.notes: Informed Owners is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion site.  There is little proper sourcing done and many stories would be classified as conspiracies or propaganda. Not credible as a news source.

israelvideonetwork.com.name: Israel Video Network
israelvideonetwork.com.notes: The Israel Video Network is a right wing pro-Israel and anti-Islam news network. As the name implies they publish video news. The content is extremely against Palestine and against liberalism in general. They use strong loaded wording in headlines and publish propaganda.

jihadwatch.org.name: Jihad Watch
jihadwatch.org.notes: Jihad Watch is a blog affiliated with the David Horowitz Freedom Center, run by blogger Robert Spencer, it has been described as one of the main homes of the anti-Islamic Counter-jihad movement on the internet.  It has been repeatedly criticized by numerous academics who believe that it promotes an Islamophobic worldview and conspiracy theories.  (Wikipedia)

jookos.com.name: Jookos News
jookos.com.notes: Jookos News is a right wing conservative biased site with loaded words and content.  Not very factual and does not shy from conspiracy theories.

learnprogress.org.name: Learn Progress
learnprogress.org.notes: Learn Progress is a news and opinion website with an extreme left wing bias.  The website consists of articles with misleading headlines, loaded words and outrageous claims without sources.  Needs fact checking.

liberalsociety.com.name: Liberal Society
liberalsociety.com.notes: Liberal Society is an extreme left news and opinion website. Liberal Society does not source to credible information and promotes left wing propaganda.

libertywritersnews.com.name: Liberty Writers News
libertywritersnews.com.notes: Liberty Writers News is a highly biased extreme right wing website that re-posts news from other sources.  Has been accused and admitted to publishing fake news stories. Simply not credible as a news source.

madworldnews.com.name: Mad World News
madworldnews.com.notes: Mad World News is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website.  This source routinely misrepresents facts and is simply not a credible source.

mediazone.news.name: Media Zone
mediazone.news.notes: Media Zone is a news and opinion website with extreme right wing bias in reporting.  This source also does not shy away from fake news, conspiracies and propaganda.

en.metapedia.org.name: Metapedia
en.metapedia.org.notes: Metapedia is an electronic encyclopedia which contains far-right, white nationalist, white supremacist, white separatist, antisemitic, Holocaust denial and neo-Nazi points of view. This source is not credible.

molonlabemedia.com.name: Molon Labe Media
molonlabemedia.com.notes: Molon Labe Media has extreme far right bias that is over the top.  They consistently publish right wing conspiracy theories that can easily be mistaken for satire.  Sadly, the content  of this site is not satire! It appears to be unintentional or intentional fake news.

myzonetoday.com.name: MyZoneToday
myzonetoday.com.notes: MyZoneToday is a far right biased news website/blog.  This sources sometimes publishes conspiracy theories and is not factual in other cases. Some news is just fake.

npiamerica.org.name: National Policy Institute
npiamerica.org.notes: The National Policy Institute (NPI) is an alt right, white nationalist, and white supremacist think tank based in Arlington, Virginia. Pure racism. This is a hate group.

nevo.news.name: Nevo News
nevo.news.notes: Nevo News has extreme right wing bias with sensational stories that are generally unproven conspiracies.  Not trustworthy for factual news.

newcenturytimes.com.name: New Century Times
newcenturytimes.com.notes: New Century Times also known as NCT is an online news website that publishes news with an extreme left wing bias.  This source also does not source all articles and many stories are not factual. Promotes left wing propaganda.

newswithviews.com.name: News With Views
newswithviews.com.notes: News With Views has the tagline “Where reality shatters illusion.”  The irony of this is not lost as this is a strongly right wing news and opinion site that is not shy about conspiracy theories. There is more illusion than reality found here.

noscomunicamos.com.name: Nos Comunicamos
noscomunicamos.com.notes: Nos Comunicamos claims to be a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy.  However, the content of its news stories consist of extreme right wing bias, open racism, Islamophobia, and tired conspiracy theories.

occupydemocrats.com.name: Occupy Democrats
occupydemocrats.com.notes: Occupy Democrats is a political and news organization with an extreme left wing bias in reporting and story choices.  Has a dismal fact check record according to Politifact.  See also Snopes. Always fact check this source! Promotes left-wing propaganda without regard to sourcing.

onlineconservativepress.com.name: Online Conservative Press
onlineconservativepress.com.notes: Extreme conservative right wing bias and numerous conspiracy theories that are not based on evidence. Promotes right wing based propaganda.

patriotupdate.com.name: Patriot Update
patriotupdate.com.notes: Over the top right wing conspiracies and propaganda. Patriot Update mostly does not source and when they do it is to other extreme right wing sites.

pmnightlynews.com.name: PM Nightly News
pmnightlynews.com.notes: PM Nightly News is a conservative news website that promotes conspiracies and also has questionable science news.  In reviewing this site the first story pulled up was a false conspiracy regarding the Clinton Foundation.  Not trustworthy.

prntly.com.name: Prntly
prntly.com.notes: Prntly is a politically conservative American website.  It was described by Snopes as “a disreputable outlet that has a penchant for publishing both fake news and spurious pro-Trump articles.”  This website could also be classified as satire or conspiracy.

proamericanews.com.name: Pro-America News
proamericanews.com.notes: There is irony in the name of this site as they appear to hate just about everything about America.  Extreme right wing bias and does not shy away from conspiracy theories, especially if it involves anyone even a shade left of center.

progressivestoday.com.name: Progressives Today
progressivestoday.com.notes: Don’t let the name fool you.  This is an extreme right wing conservative site that seems to openly endorse racism and conspiracies.

proudcons.com.name: The Proud Conservative
proudcons.com.notes: The Proud Conservative presents news with an extreme right wing bias.  Publishes information that can be false.

proud-patriots.com.name: Proud Patriots
proud-patriots.com.notes: Proud Patriots is an extreme right wing biased news and opinion website.  It does a poor job of sourcing information (if at all) and does not shy from conspiracies.

qpolitical.com.name: QPolitical
qpolitical.com.notes: QPolitical is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. Uses strong loaded words, promotes propaganda and does not always source to credible information. Has a very poor fact checking record.

react365.com.name: React 365
react365.com.notes: A service that allows people to create their own fake stories with the react365.com domain name.

reagancoalition.com.name: Reagan Coalition
reagancoalition.com.notes: The Reagan Coalition is an extreme right wing news websites that is mostly factually inaccurate and promotes conspiracy and racism.  We are pretty sure Reagan would not want his name associated with this website.

redrockdaily.com.name: Red Rock Daily News
redrockdaily.com.notes: Red Rock Daily News has an extreme right wing bias in reporting.  The website is littered with racism, Islamophobia and conspiracy.

rightsidenews.com.name: Right Side News
rightsidenews.com.notes: Right Side News presents content with an extreme right wing bias.  Publishes conspiracies and simply is not credible.

rightwingnews.com.name: Right Wing News
rightwingnews.com.notes: Right Wing News was founded by John Hawkins an extreme conservative who regularly contributes articles to the radical right. Right Wing News is often factually challenged and should not be considered a valid source.

southjerseymechanic.com.name: South Jersey Mechanic (Trump News)
southjerseymechanic.com.notes: The South Jersey Mechanic is billed as Trump News.  The website is horribly designed and simply would not work in Chrome.  It did however load on Internet Explorer.  Regardless, this is an extreme right biased site that curates news from different sources.  Not surprisingly all news is Pro-Trump.  Many of those sources come straight from our conspiracy category. Highly untrustworthy source.

stateofthenation2012.com.name: State of the Nation 2012
stateofthenation2012.com.notes: State of the Nation 2012 is a propaganda site that focuses on right wing politics.  Although debunked long ago this source continues to report on Pizzagate. They also report on the New World Order and other political conspiracies. State of the Nation 2012 does produce legitimate news among the conspiracies and propaganda.

subjectpolitics.com.name: Subject Politics
subjectpolitics.com.notes: Subject Politics is an extreme right wing news and opinion website. Uses extreme loaded words, does not source well (if at all) and promotes propaganda. Has racist content.

supremepatriot.com.name: Supreme Patriot
supremepatriot.com.notes: When you see a title like “Supreme Patriot” it must make you think this at very pro-American website that loves our constitution and all American Citizens, right?  Wrong.  This is an extreme right biased website that only seems to love white Christians.  This source has racist content and is low on the factual side.

surenews.com.name: Sure News
surenews.com.notes: Sure News is a news and opinion website that claims to report the most shocking stories without bias.  When analyzing their content it seems the most shocking stories involve African Americans and Muslims committing violent acts against whites. Extreme right wing bias that promotes racism and Islamophobia.

tdnewswire.com.name: TD Newswire
tdnewswire.com.notes: TD Newswire is a garbage dump of extreme right wing bias and conspiracies.  Refers to liberals as libtards right in the headlines and has racist content.  One of the worst right wing sites in existence.

tmn.today.name: Tell Me Now
tmn.today.notes: A web based right wing news and general information site.  Has overt bias in favor of conservatives and Donald Trump.  Publishes some conspiracy stories and has racist content.

theamericanmirror.com.name: The American Mirror
theamericanmirror.com.notes: The American Mirror is an online news and opinion website with an overt right wing bias.  Not all stories are sourced to credible information.

angrypatriotmovement.com.name: The Angry Patriot
angrypatriotmovement.com.notes: The Angry Patriot is a very right wing biased website with many conspiracies.  A very untrustworthy source.

thebostontribune.com.name: The Boston Tribune
thebostontribune.com.notes: The Boston Tribune is a right wing biased website that is attempting to sound like a legitimate newspaper.  While some of the stories on their website are real, many are not.  Snopes has found three articles on the site that are fake news.  Do not trust this site.

constitution.com.name: The Constitution
constitution.com.notes: The Constitution is an online political news and opinion source.  The Constitution has over the top right wing bias and is not very factual.  There are racist undertones with a strong nationalistic view.  Requires fact checking.

dcclothesline.com.name: The D.C. Clothesline
dcclothesline.com.notes: Extreme right wing propaganda and conspiracies. Does not source to credible information.

theduran.com.name: The Duran
theduran.com.notes: The Duran is an online news and opinion source with a strong right wing bias.  There is evidence they have posted misleading information and they have perpetuated some conspiracies. The source does produce legitimate news with a right wing bias, so we will not place them in the conspiracy category at this time.

thefederalistpapers.org.name: The Federalist Papers Project
thefederalistpapers.org.notes: The Federalist Papers Project has overt right wing bias in reporting.  It often publishes misleading news stories and conspiracies that can be considered fake news.

fairus.org.name: The Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR)
fairus.org.notes: The Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR) is a non-profit tax exempt organization in the United States that advocates changes in U.S. immigration policy that they believe would result in significant reductions in immigration, both legal and illegal.  According to the Southern Poverty Law Center The Federation for American Immigration Reform (FAIR) is a group with one mission: to severely limit immigration into the United States. Although FAIR maintains a veneer of legitimacy that has allowed its principals to testify in Congress and lobby the federal government, this veneer hides much ugliness.  FAIR has ties to white supremacist groups.

thefreepatriot.org.name: The Free Patriot
thefreepatriot.org.notes: A news and opinion website with extreme bias. Promotes propaganda and conspiracy with little credible sourcing.

thegatewaypundit.com.name: The Gateway Pundit
thegatewaypundit.com.notes: The Gateway Pundit is a hard-right website that is not afraid of conspiracy theories and the occasional flirtation with outright white supremacists.  Not a credible source that occasionally publishes fake news.

newobserveronline.com.name: The New Observer
newobserveronline.com.notes: The New Observer has extreme right wing bias.  Publishes stories that are simply not true (fake news) and uses racist language.

theproudliberal.org.name: The Proud Liberal
theproudliberal.org.notes: The Proud Liberal is a news and opinion blog with an extreme left wing bias. The Proud Liberal does attempt to source, but often it is to other left wing biased sourced. They also use extreme loaded words that attempt to influence the reader. This is a propaganda source.

thelastlineofdefense.org.name: The Resistance: The Last Line of Defense
thelastlineofdefense.org.notes: A news and opinion site with far right bias. Sources to other biased sources and promotes propaganda.

therightists.com.name: The Rightists
therightists.com.notes: A mix of Satire and Fake news.

therightstuff.biz.name: The Right Stuff
therightstuff.biz.notes: The Right Stuff is a white nationalist media hub that hosts several podcasts, including The Daily Shoah. It is part of the broader alt-right movement in the United States.  The website supports white nationalism and is a supporter of the belief of racialism, believing that races have different strengths and advantages, including in intelligence and strength (Wikipedia). Promotes fascism so the government can enforce racial purity. This is simply a hate group.

washingtonfeed.com.name: The Washington Feed
washingtonfeed.com.notes: The Washington Feed is a news and opinion blog with an extreme right wing bias. This source uses strong loaded words and does not source well to credible information. Basically this is a pretty typical propaganda source.

trueactivist.com.name: True Activist
trueactivist.com.notes: True Activist is a news and opinion website with overt left wing bias in reporting and wording.  Has a poor record with consensus science and publishes some conspiracies and always propaganda.  Always requires a fact check.

truthexaminer.com.name: Truth Examiner
truthexaminer.com.notes: The Truth Examiner is a far left sensationalized news and opinion website.  They offer stories with overt left wing biased loaded words, misleading headlines and often poorly sourced information. The source is left wing propaganda.

truthfeed.com.name: TruthFeed
truthfeed.com.notes: First, it does not have an About page.  Second, it is very far right biased that promotes conspiracies.  It publishes racist content.

truthmonitor.com.name: Truth Monitor
truthmonitor.com.notes: The Truth Monitor is an extreme Alt-right website that promotes propaganda. Examples: Article: JUST IN: HUNDREDS SHOT, MORE INJURED…The fact is solid – there is indeed 403 shootings by Feb 14th in Chicago.  The link to Breitbart then links to the Chicago Tribune – (should have just linked to the source and not link to a link).   False statement from article: “When the shootings continued to increase, Trump sent in more ATF agents at the beginning of February in an effort to reduce the gun crime epidemic that has overtaken the city.” – this is false.  They link to nothing however this news article the ATF denies that any new agents were sent or even Trump asking them too.    Lastly on this article it makes a statement which is not fact or lie but pure opinion.  It’s purely a biased statement often heard form the right: “Since Chicago has some of the strictest gun control laws in the country, what’s happening there serves as proof that gun control laws will NOT lower crime.”

truthrevolt.org.name: Truth Revolt
truthrevolt.org.notes: Truth Revolt is a website with extreme right wing bias in reporting and wording.  Displays open racism and publishes conspiracies.

unclesamsmisguidedchildren.com.name: Uncle Sams Misguided Children
unclesamsmisguidedchildren.com.notes: Uncle Sam’s Misguided Children is an extreme right wing propaganda and conspiracy website. They do publish some legitimate news so they must be fact checked on a per article basis.

usanewsflash.com.name: USA Newsflash
usanewsflash.com.notes: Over the top right wing conspiracies and propaganda.  Almost everything reported on this site is factually incorrect.

uschronicle.com.name: US Chronicle
uschronicle.com.notes: US Chronicle has overt right wing bias in reporting.  Publishes occasional conspiracy theories and often uses racist language.  Has a poor reputation with facts.

usherald.com.name: US Herald
usherald.com.notes: US Herald has extreme right wing bias in reporting.  Publishes some conspiracy theories and fake news.  Routinely uses racist language.

uspostman.com.name: US Postman
uspostman.com.notes: USPostman is an extreme right wing propaganda website that is known to publish fake news. When sourcing it uses other questionable or extreme right wing sources.  The USPostman also has a disclaimer on their website that reads: “We at uspostman cannot make any warranties about the completeness, reliability and accuracy of this information.” In other words they are trying to protect themselves from false claims.

usanewstoday.org.name: USANewsToday
usanewstoday.org.notes: USANewsToday is an extreme right biased news and opinion website.  It is not sourced well, if at all.  Several stories would be considered fake, but we think they are actually trying to be serious.  Not credible.

usapoliticsnow.com.name: USA Politics Now
usapoliticsnow.com.notes: This is a far right wing propaganda mill that advocates for conservative candidates.  The main purpose of the website appears to be the destruction of all liberals.  This source could easily be listed as a conspiracy website as most stories are devoid of credible evidence.  Totally untrustworthy and must be fact checked.

usasupreme.com.name: USA Supreme
usasupreme.com.notes: USA Supreme is a news and opinion website that has an extreme right wing bias.  A fact checking site is strongly recommended after visiting this website.

vdare.com.name: VDARE
vdare.com.notes: VDARE is an American website that publishes socio-political commentary pieces, particularly focusing on advocating for a moratorium on immigration into the United States as well as arguments related to race and American politics. According to the Southern Poverty Law Center, VDARE is an anti-immigration hate website which regularly publishes articles by prominent white nationalists, race scientists and anti-Semites. (Wikipedia) Bottom line this is a racist, anti-Semitic website.

vidmax.com.name: Vidmax
vidmax.com.notes: Publishes video’s with an extreme right wing bias. This is a propaganda site and has been called fake by other sources.

viralliberty.com.name: Viral Liberty
viralliberty.com.notes: Viral Liberty is Fake News source with an extreme right wing bias. Promotes propaganda and conspiracy without sources.

webdaily.com.name: Web Daily
webdaily.com.notes: Over the top right wing news that is laden with conspiracy and usually not factual.  Consistently publishes headlines and articles that would be offensive to minorities and Muslims.

worldnewspolitics.com.name: World News Politics
worldnewspolitics.com.notes: World News Politics is an extreme right wing news and opinion website that uses strong emotional language and does not often source to credible information.

yesimright.com.name: Yes, I’m Right
yesimright.com.notes: Yes, I’m Right, is a blog that is trying to be a news source. This source is over the top with right wing bias and unproven propaganda. Not fake news, but mostly not proven or in other words BS. This is a kind review of this retched source of extreme bias.
